Her husband, Shavkat, also has his own business - he is a hunter and a fisherman, and is also involved in buying and selling livestock at a livestock market.  She is requesting this loan to buy a new selection of spring merchandise.  Munira's oldest sons have a kiosk, where they sell movie disks and provide their small input to the family.

loans.use: to buy a spring selection of merchandise

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es:
Paquita, de 52 años de edad, es una mujer amable y trabajadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante.  Es conviviente con Isaías quien se dedica a la agricultura y es padre de sus 4 hijos Luís de 23, Paola de 21, Isamar de 18 y Anita de 12 años de edad.  Vive en compañía de su pareja y sus hijos, habitando su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Paquita es la venta de plátanos durante el día,  para eso cuenta con una mesa que instala en le frontis de su casa, desde donde atiende de manera muy amable y cordial a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos. También vende comidas preparadas como guisos, juanes, tallarines y otros por las noches en el frontis de su casa. Iniciándose con un préstamo de MFP hace más de 2 años, logrando crecer contando con el apoyo de su pareja. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja por la regular clientela que ha sabido ganarse en el tiempo que lleva en su negocio.
Le gusta su negocio pues le ha permitido salir de sus apuros económicos, decidiéndose  por la necesidad económica que atravesaba así como poder apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar. Pero, no le gusta cuando algunas veces no puede vender todo sus productos y se llega a malograr pero eso no la desanima, y realiza mejor sus cálculos de sus compras y adquiere lo necesario y evita que se descomponga, además tiene planes de hacer crecer su negocio e incrementar sus ventas. Este será el prestando numero 8 con la institución MFP, se siente tardecida por el apoyo financiero para poder concertar su planes. Por otro lado, se siente cómodo con su grupo comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en compra de plátanos e ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas como arroz, aceites y otros  a precio por mayor para así tener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Paquita, age 52, is a friendly and hardworking woman who has plenty of drive to succeed. She is in a common-law relationship with Isaías, who is a farmer and the father of their four children: Luís (age 23), Paola (age 21), Isamar (age 18), and Anita (age 12). Paquita lives with her partner and children in their own home. She sells bananas during the day from a table that is set up in front of her house. Paquita provides friendly and cordial service to her customers, most of whom are neighbors. She also sells prepared food such as stews, "juanes" (chicken and rice wrapped in a banana leaf), pasta, and other dishes at night in front of her home. Paquita started her business more than two years ago with a loan from MFP. With the help of her partner, she has been able to make her business grow. She considers her business to be profitable because of the good revenue that has been generated. In order to gain regular customers, Paquita knows that she must invest time into managing her business.

She enjoys her business because it has enabled her to get out of financial trouble. Because of their financial needs, Paquita decided that she would help her partner with the household expenses. However, she dislikes the times when she is not able to sell all of her products due to spoilage, but these moments do not discourage her. She has done a better job of calculating her purchases and acquiring only what she needs to avoid waste. Paquita also has plans to grow her business and increase her sales.

This will be her eighth loan with the MFP organization. Lately she feels that the financial support will help her follow through with her plans. Paquita is comfortable working with her Communal Bank because she considers her group to be unified and supportive. The amount of 1,500 PEN that she is requesting will be invested in bananas and ingredients for preparing her dishes such as rice, oil, and other products. By purchasing in bulk, she will be able to achieve a wider profit margin.

loans.use: to buy bananas, rice, oil, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora, a 40-year-old mother of three children, lives happily in a rural community planting rice and vegetables and raising livestock for sale. With her husband, she aims to increase their yields and income to satisfy their necessities and finance the education of their children.

They plan to expand their rice plantation to insure a high production and so are requesting a loan of P30,000 to buy necessary fertilizers and pesticides. Adora believes that this loan will help them to improve their farming business and lead to an increased harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in rice farming.

loans.name: Kerly

texts.es:
Kerly, de 24 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa decidida a salir adelante.  Es conviviente con Andy, fruto de esa unión tienen 1 hija Kaori de 4 años  de edad a quien quiere mucho, habitando cómodamente una casa alquilada. La actividad que realiza Kerly, es la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, la cual compra en la ciudad de Lima realizando viajes periódicos para realizar la compra de su mercadería, para luego venderlo desde su casa y en forma ambulatoria a sus vecinos y amistades, a quienes atiende muy bien, logrando que la recomienden con otras personas que luego se vuelven en sus clientes habituales.
 Realiza éste negocio desde hace 1 año contando con el apoyo de sus cuñadas en la búsqueda de nuevos clientes para la venta y ella sola se encarga de la cobranza de los créditos entregados.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable pues logra vender todas las ropas que trae y le dejan buenas ganancias. Le gusta su negocio pues le ha generado un oficio, además de conocer muy bien el negocio lo cual le da las facilidades de manejar bien sus ventas logrando vender cantidades considerables al mes.
Por eso tiene planes de abrir una tienda  de venta de ropas, para así no tener que caminar mucho buscando clientes. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además de sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de más ropas de diversos modelos a precio por mayor buscando menores precios por sus compras al contado y en volumen trayendo desde la capital.
texts.en:
Kerly is 24 years old. She is a hardworking, industrious, and decisive woman who wants to get ahead. Kerly is in a common-law relationship with Andy and they have a four-year-old daughter named Kaori who she loves dearly. They live comfortably in a rented house. Kerly sells clothes for women, men, and children. She makes periodic trips to the city of Lima in order to buy merchandise. Kerly sells her products from home or as a traveling merchant to neighbors and friends. She provides good service, which has resulted in recommendations to other people who have become regular customers. Her business started one year ago with the help of her sisters-in-law. They helped her find new customers and she was solely responsible for collecting payments.

Kerly considers her business to be profitable because she is able to sell all of the clothes that she has shipped in, thus resulting in good earnings. She enjoys her business because it has given her a career. Kerly has become very knowledgeable about her business and possesses the skills to manage her sales well. As a result, she is able to sell considerable quantities each month. Her plans include opening a clothing store so that she does not have to travel around looking for customers.

This will be her third loan with the MFP organization. Kerly hopes to receive assistance so that she can continue pursuing her goals. She feels good about her Communal Bank because she considers her group to be unified and supportive. The amount of 1,000 PEN that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of more clothing in different styles. By purchasing in bulk and with cash, she hopes to find the lowest prices.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
El Joven Jose Antonio es soltero, tiene 19 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educacion primaria, se dedica a la albañilería, cuenta con el apoyo de su familia, lleva 2 años de experiencia en su trabajo.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de una moto, ya que espera mejorar su trabajo y estar a tiempo, espera en el futuro tener trabajadores a su cargo.
texts.en:
Jose Antonio is 19 years old and single.  He has a third grade education.

He is a bricklayer, and he has two years of experience in his work.  He does have his family’s support.

He is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle.  He hopes to improve his work and to be on time.  He hopes that in the future he will have workers under his supervision.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
OLGA MARINA
La señora  Olga Marina se dedica al cultivo de follaje y elaboración de tejidos desde hace 5 años. tiene  2 hijos menores de edad, necesita otro crédito para seguir cosechando  desea  elaborar unas tablillas donde se cosechan todos los follajes y así mismo colocar diversidad de follajes y algunas flores como Aves del paraíso, quiere utilizar  una parte  del crédito  para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores  y tamaños   para la elaboración de sus güipiles  y  bordados de corte típico  que le han encargado  y aprovechar  el mes de abril que le solicitan  güipiles  para la semana santa quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio  y más adelante poder comprar una maquina industrial y poder elaborar blusas bordadas a máquina y así seguir apoyando esposo.
texts.en: Señora Olga Marina has been making a living by growing foliage and making fabrics for five years.  She has two young children.  She needs another loan in order to continue harvesting.  She wishes to make a few wooden panels where she would harvest the foliage and likewise get a diversity of foliage and some flowers, like birds of paradise.  She wants to use part of the loan to buy different sizes and colors of thread for making her güipiles (traditional Guatemalan dresses), and for the embroidery of traditional skirts that have been ordered, and to take advantage of the month of April because people ask for güipiles for Holy Week.  She wants to keep growing her business and later be able to buy an industrial sewing machine and be able to make embroidered shirts with the machine and thus continue supporting her husband.

loans.use: to harvest foliage and to buy raw materials to make textiles.

loans.name: Marianita De Jesus

texts.es: Marianita de Jesús tiene 48 años. Está casada con Kebler quien es estudiante. Tiene 1 hijo menor de edad. De profesión Economista vive en La Libertad que pertenece a Guayaquil. Empezó su negocio vendiendo de manera informal en un local en la Libertad. Gracias a esfuerzo y trabajo diario han salido adelante. Su negocio a progresado,  ahora tiene un local formal en el mercado de Santa Elena. En su trabajo no tiene mayores problemas ya que la ayuda su esposo. El único contratiempo es que Santa Elena queda un poco lejos de Libertad por tal motivo tiene que viajar. Su hijo es un excelente estudiante asiste a la escuela fiscal. El préstamo que está solicitando lo va a invertir aumentando su negocio comprando ropa (mujer, hombre y niño) plástico, artículos de bebe etc. Su sueño es tener varios locales de ropa para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marianita de Jesús, age 48, is married to Kebler, a student.  She has one minor child.

She is an economist by profession, and she lives in La Libertad in Guayaquil.

She started her business by selling informally at a place in La Libertad.  Thanks to her daily effort and work they have gotten ahead.  Her business has progressed.  She now has a formal place to sell at the Santa Elena market.  She does not have big problems because her husband helps her.  The only difficulty is that Santa Elena is a bit far from Libertad, so she has to travel.

Her son is an excellent student, and he goes to the state school.

The loan she is requesting is to expand her business by purchasing clothes (for women, men, and children) plastic, and baby items, etc.  Her dream is to have various clothing locations in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, underwear, and plastic.

loans.name: Maria Monserrate

texts.es: María nació en Manabí y es madre de 3 niños. Es separada, tiene 43 años vive en Guayaquil desde que tenía 30 años. Sus hijos son mayores de edad (29, 25 y 19 años) todos son independientes. María inicio su negocio hace 10 años con la ayuda de sus hijos. Se decidió porque quería aportar económicamente en la casa. Como es independiente no tiene horario de entrada ni salida pero le gusta porque así tiene tiempo para dedicarle a su familia. Ahora no tiene muchas dificultades porque sus hijos son adultos y cuenta con ellos. Desea realizar el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza, crema, perfumes. En un futuro desea abrir un bazar con vitrinas para exponer sus productos.
texts.en: María, 43, was born in Manabí.  She is separated and the mother of 3 adult, independent children, ages 29, 25 and 19. She lives in Guayaquil since she was 30 years old.  María started her business 10 years ago with the help of her children after she decided she wanted to contribute financially to the house. As she is independent, she doesn’t have a start/finish time but she likes this as she has time to devote to her family.  Now she does not have many difficulties because her children are grown and she counts on them.  She wants this loan to purchase beauty products, creams, perfumes. In the future, she wants to open a store with display cases to showcase her products.

loans.use: to purchase creams, perfume and makeup.

loans.name: Thnam

texts.en:
Thnam is 57 years old and a mother of six children. She is a widowed woman since her husband passed away a few years ago. Thnam sells ceremonial supplies such robes, presents for the monk, incense, candles and other familiar things in various places. She is able to make an average income of USD 5.00 per day. Most of her children have quit studying and started working in various occupations, and they share some of their income to help the family. Two among them are already married and live separately. 

Due to the lack of a vehicle for her children's commuting to work, Thnam would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorcycle to meet the family’s needs. This motorcycle will enable her family to reduce some monthly transportation expenses. In the future, Thnam wants to own a medium sized store for selling ceremonial supplies.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to meet the family’s needs.

loans.name: Kean

texts.en:
Kean, 47, is a hardworking villager from Kompong Cham province. He is a farmer, cultivating rice crops alongside his spouse to generate income for the family. He has been in the business with more than 30 years of experience. He has four single children and a married child. Two among them are employed as garment-sewing staff in the province.

To improve his business, Kean is asking for a loan from HKL to purchase a cow for farming purposes. And with the remaining amount, he wants to buy zinc (sheet metal) to replace a broken wall. He hopes to provide his family good living conditions through using the loan and as he strives to work harder. 

For his business goal, he expects to buy extra farmland to increase his rice production so that he can sell some for more profit.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for farming purposes.

loans.name: Gradi Plus Group

texts.en:
Gradi Plus is a Community Bank made up of twelve micro-entrepreneurs whose chairwoman is Alphonsine. These members are united for the same goal: to grow their businesses with loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC.

Alphonsine runs a restaurant in the mid-western area of Kinshasa. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of four children who are between the ages of 7 and 20. All of them attend school. 

She started her restaurant in 2008 with a beginning capital of US$80. With hard work and good management, and by providing good customer service, Alphonsine’s business has prospered and has permanent customers to keep it up. She has already received and successfully repaid eight loans from the MFI HOPE DRC. Her business generates $180 of profit per week. 

Alphonsine is planning with the new loan to diversify her business by adding beverages to generate additional profits. Her ambition is to someday become a beverage provider in her environment.

loans.use: to diversify her business by adding beverages to generate additional profits.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Soeung

texts.en:
Soeung is 54 years old and a widowed mother who has been operating a groceries selling business in her neighborhood. She owns a convenience shop with many types of products such as snacks, beverages, home use products, personal care products and other familiar things. She has one of her children to help her in the business every day. Soeung has four children, three of whom are employed in various careers and help their mother earning the income to support the family. Only her last-born child is still studying in the local school. Presently, Soeung lives with her two single children and her older sister in a home in Phnom Penh.

To sustain the growth of the business, Soeung would like to take out a loan through HKL, one of Kiva's partners, to purchase ingredients and spices for food and to buy stock of inventory like beverages, snacks and home use products to refill her store again. In the future, Soeung hopes that she is able to enlarge her store and increase her household income.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and spices for food and to buy stock of inventory like beverages, snacks and home use products to refill her store again.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is a 41 year old married woman who has three grown children. She has been engaged in selling food in their community for five years. Delia is a very hospitable and hardworking person. She does everything for the benefits of her family. She is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy milk, pasta and ingredients for her business to have additional income and to be able able to sustain the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy milk, pasta and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Samay

texts.en:
Samay, 44, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a driver, earning about USD 5 per day. One of her children rents a Tuk Tuk to run public transportation (Tuk Tuk taxi). He earns about USD 6 per day.  

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Samay wants to have her own Tuk Tuk for her son to run the taxi service. Therefore, Samay is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a Tuk Tuk. This purchase will help her son to earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a food store and rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her son to run the taxi service.

loans.name: Sorm

texts.en:
Sorm is 27 years old and a resident of Kompong Cham province. She is married and has one child who attends a local primary school. She and her husband help each other to farm their crops to generate income. Agriculture is the main source of her family’s income. Sorm grows various types of crops based on the season and the market demand.

To obtain a fruitful harvest from this project, Sorm would like to borrow some funds to buy fertilizers and pesticides to maintain good conditions for her rice crops, and also to pay for threshing service fees. This loan will enable her to have enough capital to invest in the business. 

For the future business, Sorm anticipates she will own a wide farmland, renovate her house, and provide her child further education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and also pay for threshing service fees.

loans.name: Kak

texts.en:
Kak is one of residents from Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is 57 years old and married. She has six children, all of whom have independent lives and live separately with their own families around the province. Kak is a farmer who owns a few hectares of farmland for rice cultivation, while her husband is in the business of making mortars and pestles and grinders for sale. Kak’s husband has his frequent customers who come to buy his products in the village.

Kak is asking for a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to purchase raw mortar for her husband to make mortars and pestles and grinders. She hopes to obtain a good income from the investment. In the future, she would like to expand her family-owned business and save some money to renovate her present house.

loans.use: to purchase raw mortar for her husband to make mortars and pestles and grinders.

loans.name: Balbara

texts.en:
A very smiling and hardworking mother of three grown up children, Balbara is married to Marcelo. She is 36 years old. Balbara is engaged in selling food to the people of the community. She is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 13,000 to buy milk, coconut, sugar and ice for her business. 

According to Balbara, this loan is going to be a big help for her to have additional income to be able to sustain the need of her family. Balbara hopes that her business can expand so that she can give a quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy milk, coconut, sugar and ice for her business.

loans.name: Fayzi

texts.ru: Файзи  сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2008 года. Она  замужем имеет 5 детей. Ее муж является водителем маршрутного такси.Заработная плата мужа уходит только на повседневные нужды. Файзи сама работает в дехканском хозяйстве в отделе кадров.Так как ее дом нуждается в обновлении на полученный кредит она хочет отремонтировать свой дом. В течении 4 лет она получает кредит и с мужем стараются вовремя погашать кредит.Она с мужем благодарна за финансовую поддержку от КИВА.
texts.en: Fayzi has been partnering with our organization since 2008.  She is married and has five children.  Her husband is a driver of a shuttle taxi.  His salary covers only daily needs.  Fayzi works in a human resources department at a dekhan farm.  Because her house needs remodeling, she wants to use this loan to make repairs to her house.  She has been obtaining loans for four years, and she and her husband try to repay loans in a timely manner.  Fayzi and her husband are grateful for the financial support from Kiva.

loans.use: to repair her home

loans.name: Una Luz En El Camino Group

texts.es: Doña Vilma es  miembro del Grupo Solidario Una Luz en el Camino, tiene 40 años de edad, es casada madre de 4 hijas, y su esposo es agricultor. Ella junto a su familia reside en la comunidad de la venta, municipio de Juticalpa. Doña Vilma desde hace diez años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, oficio que lo aprendió de su mama ya que desde muy pequeña le enseño a  trabajar, es una familia de muy escasos recursos económicos pero muy trabajadora y luchadora. Ella trabaja en conjunto con sus hijas, la elaboración de pan lo hace dos veces por semana, comienzan desde las 5:00 am y culminan a las 3:00 pm. Uno de los problemas que enfrenta es que le afecta el calor del horno ya que en tiempo de verano la temperatura se vuelve más fuerte. El préstamo que doña Vilma solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de huevos, harina, azúcar, soda, entre otros. Una de sus metas es hacer un horno en su casa y tener una buena galera para cubrirse del sol en tiempo de verano y en el invierno cubrirse de la lluvia. Con el apoyo de este préstamo doña Vilma podrá continuar con su negocio mayor surtido y eso le alegra mucho porque sus condiciones de vida serán mejores. Doña Vilma tiene 15 años de ser clienta de FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en: Ms. Vilma is a member of the Una Luz en el Camino microfinance group. She is a 40-year-old married mother of 4 girls, and her husband is a farmer. She and her family reside in the La Venta community, in the municipality of Juticalpa. Ms. Vilma has been baking and selling bread for ten years, a job which she learned from her mother at a young age. Hers is a low-income but hardworking family. She works alongside her daughters, making bread twice a week. They start at 5:00 a.m. and finish at 3:00 p.m. One of the problems she faces is that the heat from the oven affects them because during summer, the temperature rises significantly. Ms. Vilma needs this loan to invest it in purchasing eggs, flour, sugar, baking soda, and other products. One of her goals is to build an oven in her home and to have a nice outbuilding to protect themselves from the sun in the summer and the rain in the winter. With your support, Ms. Vilma will be able to continue with her business and offer a greater selection, which makes her happy because her living conditions will improve. Ms. Vilma has been a FAMA client for 15 years and has paid off her loans punctually.

loans.use: to purchase flour, eggs, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im is 44 years old, and lives in the Baray district of Cambodia.  She has five children.  Im runs a farming business on a few hectares of farmland that she owns.  This includes land for dry season rice, on which she grows rice crops to generate income for her family. Her husband helps her with the farming business, as well as working as a fisherman.

With the loan Im has requested from HKL, she would like to buy seeds and four sacks of fertilizer for rice farming. She is very happy about the loan, which will enable her to further improve her business. She hopes to obtain a fruitful harvest in the coming season. In the future, Im plans to buy extra land to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and four sacks of fertilizer for rice farming.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро сотрудничает с нашей организацией  с 2009 года. У не 3 дочери и 2 сына. Она сама ездит за товаром,ее младшая дочь помогает в торговле. Этим видом деятельности занимается 4 года. Раньше Зухра делила свой бизнес с сестрой и племянницей.Теперь спустя год, после получения кредита, отделила свой бизнес от родственников и продолжила торговлю.У нее теперь собственный бизнес и дела идут хорошо. В настоящее время привозит товар летних шлепанцев и другой летней обуви.
texts.en: Zuhro has been partnering with our organization since 2009.  She has three daughters and two sons.  She travels for merchandise herself, and her youngest daughter helps her with the sales.  Zuhro has been involved in this business for four years.  She previously split this business with her sister and niece.  Now, a year later, she separated the business from the relatives after obtaining a loan and continues her sales.  She now has her own business and things are going well.  Currently, she will be bringing in an inventory of summer slippers and other summer shoes.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula tiene 43 años de edad, es soltera. Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras de forma ambulante en canastos recorre su comunidad y una ciudad del oriente del país, siempre ha trabajado de esta forma, fue su mamá quien le enseño. Paula compra la mercadería cada dos días en la zona.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar más verdura y comprar dos cerdos. De esta manera aumentara el negocio al ofrecer mayor variedad de mercadería. Ella desea instalar una pequeña tienda más adelante.
texts.en:
Paula, 43, is single.  She sells vegetables out of large baskets she carries from place to place in her community and in a city in the east of the country.  She’s always worked this way; her mother taught her.  Paula buys merchandise every other day in the area.

The loan she’s asking for is to buy more vegetables and to buy two pigs so that she can increase the business offering a wider variety of merchandise. She wants to open a small store later on.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and to buy two pigs.

loans.name: Las Rancheritas Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Elvira es casada, tiene 29 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos los cuales estudian, se dedica a la confección de ropa, inició este trabajo siendo costurera con una maquina simple y hasta ahora lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de una maquina para costura, y mejorar su producción de tejidos, en el futuro espera contar con varias maquinas para mejorar su producción . 
Las demás integrantes se dedica a la confección de ropa y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
María Elvira, 29, is married.  She completed the six grades of elementary school.  She has four children attending school.  She is a clothes maker.  She started this work with a simple machine and now has six years’ experience.

She organizes a group to request a loan that she’ll use to buy a sewing machine and improve her textiles.  In the future she’d like to own several machines to improve production.  The other members sew clothes and raise animals.

loans.use: to buy a machine.

loans.name: Maria Regina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Regina es casada, tiene 49 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a la elaboración de zapatos de cuero para damas y caballeros, inicio este trabajo con el apoyo de su esposo y hasta el momento lleva 18 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de materiales, consistente en cuero de diferente colore para aumentar el volumen de producción que realiza. Espera seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Regina is a 49-year-old married woman who never got the opportunity to study. She makes leather shoes for men and women for a living. She started the business with her husband's support, and has 18 years of experience.

She is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase materials like leather in different colors so that she can increase productivity. She hopes to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase leather.

loans.name: Emilio Efrain

texts.es:
EL señor Emilio Efrain es casado, tiene 50 años de edad, cursó los grados de educacion primaria, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales ninguno esta estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría, inició este negocio gracia al la enseñanza de su señor padre y hasta el momento lleva 32 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa que se dedica al tricotado de hilos.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima, consistente en hilos de diferente clases y colores y así mejorar su producción de tejido. Espera en el futuro tener una negocio bien capitalizado.
texts.en:
Mr. Emilio Efrain is a 50-year-old married man with an elementary school education. He has 3 children, none of whom are in school. He weaves for a living. He started this business thanks to the training that he received from his father, and he now has 32 years of experience. He has support from his wife, who does the knitting.

He is requesting a loan that he will use to purchase raw materials like different types and colors of thread, so that he can improve productivity. He hopes to be able to have a strong business.

loans.use: to purchase thread for weaving.

loans.name: Brenda Alicia

texts.es:
Brenda tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la tierra, hoy en día trabaja junto a sus hermanos en la siembra de maíz. 
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo es para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar el maíz y obtener la cosecha para la venta y para consumo de su hogar. Ella desea mejorar su vivienda para vivir más cómoda.
texts.en:
Brenda, 27, is single.  Her parents taught her to work in the fields when she was very little.  Today she works alongside her siblings planting corn.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy farm supplies to plant corn and obtain a harvest to sell and for home consumption.  She wants to make home improvements to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies to plant corn.

loans.name: José María

texts.es:
José tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero. Él se dedica desde hace ocho años a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió por necesidad. Además se dedica a la pesca  ya que vive cerca de una laguna. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar los insumos agrícolas para sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Lo que obtenga de la cosecha lo podrá vendar y la otra parte para su propio consumo, de las ganancias que reciba las utilizara para mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
José, 25, is single.  He’s been working in agriculture for 8 years, an occupation he learned due to need.  He also fishes since he lives near a lagoon.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy farm supplies to plant 14,000 square meters of corn.  What he obtains in his harvest he will be able to sell and part of it will be for his own consumption.  He will use any profits he gets to make home improvements.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies to plant 14000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Choek

texts.en:
Choek is an industrious mother, who lives in the Prey Chor district, in the Kompong Cham province of Cambodia. In order to provide her two children with basic necessities and good education, Choek devotes her time to working at a construction site alongside her husband.  She carries things back and forth for the professional workers, and sometimes serves food for the construction team. 

In addition to this work, Choek owns and manages a business as a farmer, mainly in the rainy season.  She would like to take out a loan through HKL, one of Kiva's partners, to pay the land fees for the farm land. She will use the land to grow rice, so that she can ensure enough daily sustenance for the family. This will be her third loan with HKL, and she has already repaid the previous loans successfully. Choek told us that the loan is very helpful for her family, and she is very grateful to the kind lenders who provide her loan.

loans.use: to pay land fees for farm land.

loans.name: Wendy Abigail

texts.es:
La Señorita Wendy Abigail es soltera, tiene 19 años de edad, es de profesión maestra de educación, pero se dedica a prestar sus servicios de maestra, secretaria, y a la misma vez es comerciantes, como comerciante lleva 3 años de experiencia, inició este negocio con poco capital. Cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de productos y tener una tienda mas surtida: aguas gaseosas, jugos, golosinas, parafinas, dulces, lácteos y embutidos, etc. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio amplio.
texts.en:
Miss Wendy Abigail is a 19-year-old single woman who is a teacher, but she also provides tutoring and secretarial services. At the same time, she is also a shopkeeper with three years of experience. She started this business with very little capital, but she has the support of her parents.

She is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase products and offer a wider selection at her store. These products include soda pop, juice, snacks, candles, candy, dairy products, canned goods, and others. She hopes to have a larger business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her store.

loans.name: Vilma Gladis

texts.es:
La señora Vilma tiene 38 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene tres hijos. Ella se dedica al comercio, fue su esposo quien le enseño ya tiene siete años de conocerlo y él se dedica a esta actividad desde hace veinte años. La mercadería la trae un primo de su esposo de Guatemala y ellos pagan transporte desde donde viven hasta la capital de país para ir a traer la mercadería cada ocho días.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar ropa para adultos (mujeres y hombres), ya que por el momento solo venden ropa para bebe. Con la inversión ellos desean abrir el mercado a otra clase de clientes y tener la posibilidad de obtener mejores ingresos económicos para su familia y puedan vivir más cómodos.
texts.en:
Vilma, 38, has a spouse and three children.  She’s a merchant.  Her husband taught her and she’s known him for seven years and he’s been in the business for twenty years.  One of her husband’s cousins brings the merchandise from Guatemala and they pay transportation costs from where they live to the nation’s capital to go get the merchandise every eight days.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy clothes for adults (women and men) because at present they only sell clothes for infants.  With this investment they want to open their market to other kinds of customers and have the opportunity of obtaining better income for their family so that they can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy clothes for adults.

loans.name: So

texts.en:
So is 41 years old.  She is a farmer who lives with her husband and three children in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province.  Rice farming is the main business activity of her family and she has been involved in this business for more than 20 years.  With the income saved as a result of selling the harvested crop, So is able to provide daily meals for her children.  So also takes some time to make and sell palm sugar to earn extra income.  Recently, two of her children began working in the construction field to contribute to supporting the family.

So is now requesting a loan in order to buy a motorcycle for her two sons to use in commuting to their workplaces.  This motorcycle will improve her living conditions and reduce some expenses during the month.  As a result, So will be able to save some money for any future emergencies her family faces.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her two sons to use in commuting to their workplaces.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Kan is 33 years old, and a local farmer from Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham, Cambodia. She was born and grew up there on a family farm. Kan has been in the farming business gaining practical experience for more than 20 years. She has a common-law partner, who is a construction worker, and has three school-age children. 

Kan has requested a loan from HKL to purchase construction tools to support her husband's business. With the tools, Kan’s husband will be able to provide additional construction services to his customers, and therefore increase the household income. Kan is committed to working hard to ensure a good education and bright future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to support her husband's business.

loans.name: Moa

texts.en:
Mao, 59, is married, resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been in animal husbandry for over four years and are successful in their career. They are involved in fattening up pigs and poultry. They earn approximately USD 5 per day. Three of her children are employed as cleaners and as a masseur. They earn approximately USD 10 per day. 

In order to improve her business, Mao is requesting a loan of USD 1300 to purchase fodder for feeding the animals. By doing so, she would be able to breed her animals to gain weight faster and earn more profit. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get their bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for feeding her animals

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad is 54 years old married with three grown children. She is a diligent person and loving mother. She has been engaged in raising hogs for six years. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed and piglets for her business. She will sell the piglets in the future so that she can meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Franky Arley

texts.es:
Franky es un joven que se encuentra casado y tiene 4 hijos de 5, 4, 3, y 1 año de edad, a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer una buena calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso. Franky anteriormente tenía un empleo con el cual devengaba un salario para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar, sin embargo, hace aproximadamente 3 años se quedó sin empleo y con la necesidad de generar los ingresos para su hogar decidió salir a la calle y rebuscarse su sustento. Fue así como encontró un lugar donde podía lavar y cuidar carros y posteriormente montó una choza de venta de dulces con lo que hasta el día de hoy ha venido generando los ingresos suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos en su hogar. Gracias a la buena atención que ofrece Franky, su negocio se ha logrado posicionar en el sector y ya es bastante reconocido por sus clientes, y es por esto que ahora busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de comprar surtido de dulces para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad y así aumentar sus ventas.

De esta manera su negocio podrá seguir saliendo adelante creciendo cada vez más, de tal manera que su familia podrá gozar de unos mayores ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Franky sueña con ofrecerle a sus 4 hijos una buena educación y con su negocio sueña algún día poder tenerlo ubicado dentro de un local propio.
texts.en:
Franky is a young married man with four children who are 5, 4, 3 and 1 year old who he’s always wanted to provide good quality of life and greater opportunities for progress to.  

Franky used to have a salaried job that helped him pay household expenses but about three years ago he lost his job and needing to generate income for his household he decided to head out into the streets looking for a way to earn a living.  This is how he came across a place where he could care for and wash cars and later on he opened a booth to sell candy which is how he’s been earning income sufficient to meet household expense to date.

Thanks to the good service Fry provides, his business has managed to position itself in the sector and is quite well known by his customers and this is why he’s now looking for a loan to buy an assortment of candy to offer a wider variety to his customers and increase sales this way.

In this way his business will continue to make progress growing more each day so that his family can enjoy higher income and have a better quality of life.  Franky dreams with offering his four children a good education and hopes one day to have his business located in a locale of his own.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of candy to sell.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Chin, 38, is a responsible mother who resides in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She has become a single parent who lives with her elderly mother and three unmarried children. She runs a small convenience shop from her home, selling a variety of products for extra income. However, agriculture is the family's main business activity. Chin devotes herself to rice farming and hog raising to generate a proper income for the family. She has been involved in the business since 2009.

Chin wants to renovate and expand her kitchen, so she has decided to request a loan from HKL to purchase wooden boards and zinc for construction. This will be her sixth cycle loan from our firm. She says that HKL is a reliable microfinance institution, and that’s why she has been with it for many years. She is very happy for the funds to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase wooden boards and zinc for construction.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang, 57, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in agriculture for over ten years. She has extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. Her husband helps her run the business. In order to improve her business, Neang is requesting a loan of USD 1300 to purchase a walking tractor to use for tilling her farmland. This purchase will help her work run smoothly. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at to generate extra income to support the family. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a walking tractor to use for tilling her farmland

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
Nuon is a rice farmer living in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. He involved himself in this business to make a living and support his family, and he now has 27 years of experience.  

He is 48 years old and has one married child and three single children. Nuon and his wife try to work hard in the rice field to ensure a high yield. They want their school-age children earn university degrees, so they might have good jobs rather than being forced to work in the fields like their parents. 

Nuon would like to maintain his farming business, so he decided to borrow additional capital to make improvements. He would like to acquire a loan of KHR 600,000 to purchase organic and chemical fertilizers to put on his land. He hopes to obtain a fruitful harvest in the coming season by using the loan from our lenders. Nuon has already paid off his previous loans successfully, and this will be his fifth loan with HKL.

loans.use: to purchase organic and chemical fertilizers for his land.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap, 48, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has selling noodles and coffee for over six years, earning approximately USD 8 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. In order to improve her business, Sopheap is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase tables and chairs to expand her store. This purchase would enable her to adequately serve her clients. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs to expand her store

loans.name: Sek

texts.en:
Sek is a 45-year-old married woman and a responsible mother who has been residing in the Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She has been a single parent for a few years and now lives in a home with her two single children. Sek is a farmer, growing rice over the past two years. She successfully manages her daily tasks because she has been farming for over 25 years.

Sek now is seeking a loan of KHR 3,000,000 to purchase a cow. The cow will enable her to maintain the rice field and help the family to reduce some plowing expenses. Her business goal is to own a farm, and breed cows.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a serger sewing machine.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura es una persona muy trabajadora que siempre ha buscado que su familia tenga una buena calidad de vida, es por esto que cuando el salario que ganaba su esposo no era suficiente para sostener todos los gastos de su hogar, decidió montar su propio negocio con el cual le pudiera ofrecer a sus 2 hijos y su esposo una buena calidad de vida. Laura empezó con la venta de comidas rápidas desde hace ya aproximadamente 3 años, actividad que la aprendió de una hermana suya la cual le acompañó durante un tiempo hasta que fuese capaz de atender su negocio por si sola. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus comidas, Laura ha logrado captar una gran cantidad de clientes y esto le ha permitido crecer mucho en el poco tiempo que lleva trabajando, y gracias a esto sus ingresos le han permitido a su familia tener una buena calidad de vida y sus hijos han logrado acceder a una educación de mejor calidad. Últimamente en su negocio ha tenido grandes pedidos de sus clientes y sus ventas han aumentado considerablemente, es por esto que busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus comidas y así poder seguir respondiendo a las buenas ventas de su negocio de comidas rápidas.

De esta manera seguirá creciendo y seguirá generando ingresos con los cuales su familia podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar. Laura sueña con poder algún día tener su negocio ubicado en un local propio donde pueda ofrecer una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Laura is a hardworking person who has always seen that her family has a good quality of life which is why when she noted that her husband’s salary was insufficient to cover all household expenses she decided to set up her own business to offer her two children and her husband a good quality of life.

Laura started selling fast food about three years ago, an activity she learned from one of her sisters who stayed by her side for a time until she felt ready to handle the business by herself.  Thanks to the good quality of dishes, Laura has won over a large number of customers and this has allowed her to grow much in the short time she’s been working and thanks to this her income has allowed her family to have a good quality of life and her children have access to a better quality education.

Lately the business has had large customer orders and sales have increased considerably which is why she’s looking for a loan to buy ingredients to prepare her meals and be able to continue responding to the good sales in her fast food business.  In this way she will continue growing and generating income with which her family can enjoy a better quality of life and greater economic opportunities to make progress.  Laura dreams with being able one day to have her business located in a space of her own where she can offer better customer service.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare her dishes.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is a generous and industrious woman who supports her sister's children's education. She is 57 years of age and still single. She lives within the village of Divisoria. 

Rosenda owns a farm where she grows rice. She is indeed thankful because her previous loan has had a great impact, helping her to improve the soil and growth of her rice crops. She paid back her previous loan and is asking for additional capital, in the amount of PHP 50,000. She will use this loan to buy farm supplies and to hire laborers to prepare the farm plot for this next planting season. She hopes that this loan will help her in making her business more productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Sa Em

texts.en: Sa Em, 33, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle for over ten years, earning approximately USD 6 per day. Her husband and her son are construction workers who earn about USD 10 per day. Due to the difficulty of her family’s transportation, Sa Em is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to purchase more farmland to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en: Sarom, 47, is widowed and resides with two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been selling porridge for over six years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her children are construction workers who earn about USD 8 per day. In order to improve her family’s income, Sarom is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase groceries for resale. By doing so, she would be able to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for resale

loans.name: Maqboolan's Group

texts.en:
Maqboolan is married and a mother to three sons and a daughter. Her eldest son sells quilts while her daughter supports her in managing the household. 
Maqboolan is a very talented lady, operating a business making strainers. She makes very traditional strainers from bamboo (an item used to filter out the dust of wheat, rice, lentils, etc.). This is her family's business. She operates it with her husband. 
Her husband purchases bamboo sticks. They both make different designs of strainers and also trays (to serve food) to sell to different markets and shops.  
Maqboolan has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her family business. With the loan, her husband will buy bamboo sticks in larger quantities that will help in fulfilling orders on time. 
Maqboolan and her husband are very experienced in this business and confident about their success as a result of the loan investment.

Note: One of the members has a sewing business--that's why she is showing it in the picture.

loans.use: To buy bamboo sticks to make strainers and trays to sell.

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her decorative embroidery business. She is very talented in her work and prepares beautiful embroidered clothes for her clients. Due to her good quality work, she receives regular orders every month. 
With the loan, she will buy embroidery supplies such as embroidery frames, beads, colored threads, etc. in larger quantities and of better quality. This will help her do her work better and earn higher profits.
She is the mother of two sons and a daughter. All of them are young and remain at home. 
Bashiraan is a very hardworking lady. Along with her business, she also performs her household duties very well. 
She is confident that her business will improve after investing the loan and that her family will be able to enjoy a better financial life as a result.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for decorative embroidery business.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is 43 years old and married with three children. Melody's husband works as a farmer in their village. Melody raises hogs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 19 years and usually receives an income of PHP 2,500 per piglet. 

At this time, Melody is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vaccines for the proper growth of her hogs. She hopes to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for the proper growth of her hogs.

loans.name: Nasira's Group

texts.en:
Nasira has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to expand her husband’s clothing business. 
With the loan he will buy a better variety of clothes in bulk that will allow him to offer more choice to his clients. This will increase his sales and income.  
Nasira is an efficient lady and performs her household duties very well. She also helps her husband financially by sewing clothes. She works for ladies in the community and sews beautiful clothes for them at reasonable rates.  
She is a positive lady and is confident that her husband will be more successful in his business after investing this loan.

loans.use: To buy clothes for clothing business.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn is from the village of Disimuray. She is 27 years old and married with two school-aged children. Emelyn has been engaged in raising hogs for eight years and earns approximately PHP 7,000 per head. Emelyn wants more hogs to raise, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, Emelyn is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vaccines and additional hogs. Emelyn is thankful because, through her loan, she will be able to raise her hogs and to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and additional hogs to raise.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is married and has four sons and a daughter. Her two eldest sons work, while her other children are continuing their education. 

Nusrat herself is a beautician by profession and offers beauty-related services to her clients. She is very skillful and operates her business from home. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for further expansion of her husband’s agricultural products selling business. With the loan investment, he will buy wheat, rice, and other products for selling for profit. 

He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for the past many years. Nusrat is hopeful that the loan investment will help him to make his business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products (wheat, rice, etc.) for her husband's business.

loans.name: Zoila Victoria

texts.es: Zoila vive en Duran, tiene 30 años y es madre soltera. Nació en Guayaquil pero al comprometerse fue a vivir a Duran. Cuando su esposo la abandono su vida se volvia dura al quedar madre soltera pero eso no le imposibilitado llegar a sus metas. Empezó con la vulcanizadora por su hermana  quien se la vendió. Por ser mujer a tenido que luchar en un área que es realizada por hombres. Actualmente le va bien en su negocio y tiene un operario a su cargo. Como es soltera y tiene un hijo menor de edad su mayor problema es la delincuencia pero gracias a Dios no ha tenido ningún contratiempo. El crédito lo va a utilizar para la compra de una Patula Hidráulica, maquinaria que sería utilizada en su vulcanizadora. Su meta próxima es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en: Zoila is a 30-year-old single mother who lives in Duran. She was born in Guayaquil, but upon getting engaged, she moved to Duran. When her husband left her, life got more difficult as she became a single mother; however, this did not keep her away from reaching her goals. She got her start in the tire repair business because her sister sold the shop to her. As a woman, she has had to work hard in a predominantly male field. Nevertheless, her business has prospered, and she now has someone working for her. Being a single mother with an underage son, her biggest problem is crime, but thank God she has not had any setbacks. She will use this loan to purchase a hydraulic machine that will be used in her tire repair shop. Her next goal is to finish building her house.

loans.use: to purchase a machine for her tire repair shop.

loans.name: Maria Celina

texts.es:
Maria es una gran emprendedora que ha tenido que superar grandes adversidades en su vida, para lo cual sus ganas de trabajar y de salir adelante han sido fundamentales para seguir progresando en su vida. Maria es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 2 hijas a quienes su padre abandonó desde hace mucho tiempo y en la actualidad no saben nada de el. Antes de que el padre de sus hijas los abandonara, Maria contaba con un empleo en una empresa de confección donde generaba unos ingresos para aportar económicamente en su hogar y así ofrecía una buena calidad de vida en su hogar, sin embargo, debido al abandono del padre de sus hijas se vio en la obligación de generar todos los ingresos por sí sola y así los ingresos que recibía por su empleo no eran suficientes para poder sostener todos los gastos que se generaban en su hogar. Con el ánimo entonces de generar ingresos superiores, Maria decidió montar su propio negocio en busca de mayores oportunidades económicas, y fue así como montó un taller de confección en su casa de ropa interior donde trabaja todos los días fuertemente y gracias al cual ha logrado brindarles a sus 2 hijas una mejor calidad de vida. Debido a que tiene grandes pedidos por parte de sus clientes, Maria busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de insumos y materias primas que requiere para la confección de sus productos y así responder a todos los pedidos de sus clientes. 
De esta manera podrá seguir creciendo en su negocio y podrá seguir generando más empleo, ya que en la actualidad tiene la oportunidad de generar un empleo con el cual le puede ofrecer una buena oportunidad a una persona. Además, Maria sueña con salir adelante con sus hijas y llegar a tener un gran negocio.
texts.en:
María is a great entrepreneur who has had to overcome great adversities in her life; her willingness to work and to get ahead has been fundamental for her to continue making progress in life.

María is a single mother, head of household.  She has two daughters whose father abandoned them some time ago and they currently have no news of him.  Before the father of her daughters left them, María had a job in a clothes making firm that generated income she could contribute toward household expenses thus offering good quality of life at home.  However, due to the father of her daughters’ abandonment she found herself obliged to generate all the income by herself so what she earned from her job was insufficient to cover all household expenses.

Hoping to generate higher income, María decided to start her own business seeking better economic opportunities and this is how she set up a sewing workshop at home where she makes underwear.  She works hard every day and thanks to this she’s been able to offer her two daughters a better quality of life.

Because she has large pending orders, María is looking for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy supplies and raw materials needed to make the items to respond to her customer orders.  In this way she will be able to continue to grow in her business and be able to generate more employment since she’s currently able to provide one job which provides a good opportunity for one other person.  In addition, María dreams with getting ahead with her daughters and to have a great business one day.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Herminio

texts.en:
Herminio is the father of three children. He is married to Grace who works in a direct-selling business. Her eldest son has finished secondary education while the second child is out of school and the youngest is still studying.

Herminio owns a farm, where he grows rice. Aside from farming, Herminio is also involved in transportation, particularly motorcycle transport. He is grateful because the income generated from his farming and transportation business pays for their household expenditures, allowances, school fees and other obligations to traders where he gets his farm supplies. Herminio has maintained his good track record since he started borrowing additional working capital from ASKI. He has paid back his previous loan. Now he is asking for another loan in the amount of P37,000 which will be used to buy farm supplies and pay for the irrigation of his rice field. He hopes that he can gain a plentiful harvest during this next crop season to be able to obtain greater profits which will serve his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay for the irrigation of his rice field.

loans.name: Muniran's Group

texts.en:
Muniran is married and a mother of two sons. Both of them operate a tailoring shop and offer sewing services to their clients. 
Muniran is a housewife, and remains at home performing her household duties. She is still very active at the age of 57 and performs her household duties very well. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to expand her eldest son’s tailoring business. With the loan, he will buy a new sewing machine and thread that will allow him to fulfill larger orders on time. This will increase his profits. 
He is very skilful in his work. Muniran is very hopeful that the loan will bring positive financial changes to his business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and thread.

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s fruit sales business. With the loan investment, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits for selling to his clients.  He is a very hardworking and experienced person in his business. He makes good sales from his business and his clients are very satisfied with his quality fruits and they prefer buying from him. 

Shameem herself is a housewife who remains at home and does her household responsibilities. She has given birth to 5 children. All of them are enrolled in school and getting their education. Shameem is confident about her family’s better future as a result of her husband’s business improvement.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for selling

loans.name: Edgar Jose

texts.es:
Edgar es un gran emprendedor que ha luchado fuertemente en su vida para salir adelante y poder brindarles a sus 2 hijos una buena calidad de vida. Como padre soltero de sus 2 hijos, debido que la madre de sus hijos los abandonó desde hace un tiempo, Edgar se ha destacado por ofrecerles una buena educación y una buena calidad de vida, y esto le ha dado fuerzas para seguir trabajando fuertemente, pues su principal preocupación es el bienestar de sus 2 hijos. Debido a que en su empleo no devenga un salario con el cual pueda sostener todos los gastos que se generan en su hogar, Edgar decidió iniciar su negocio alterno a su empleo de venta de mercancía donde ofrece productos como prendas de vestir, cosméticos, perfumes, y demás productos de uso personal. Gracias a este negocio ha logrado generar ingresos extras y poder tener en su hogar una mejor calidad de vida; y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos y la buena atención que ofrece, ha logrado aumentar sus ventas considerablemente, de modo que ahora tiene grandes pedidos por parte de sus clientes que busca satisfacer con un préstamo que le permita comprar productos de uso personal para poder responder a todos los pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.
De esta manera su negocio podrá seguir creciendo y así seguirá generando ingresos extras con los cuales sus 2 hijos podrán gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar. Edgar sueña con sacar sus 2 hijos adelante brindándoles una buena educación y una estabilidad económica que les permita salir adelante en un futuro.
texts.en:
Edgar is a great entrepreneur who has worked hard his entire life to get ahead and be able to provide his two children with a good quality of life.  As a single father of two children because the mother of his children abandoned them some time ago Edgar has stood out for offering them a good education and good quality of life.  This has given him the strength to work hard because his main concern is his two children’s wellbeing.

Because his job did not produce a high enough salary to cover all expenses generated by his household, Edgar decided to start a business in addition to his job.  He sells merchandise like clothes, cosmetics, perfume and other personal use items.  Thanks to this business he’s been able to generate extra income in order to have better quality of life at home and thanks to the good quality of the products he offers and the good service he provides his sales have increased considerably to such an extent that he now has large pending orders from his customers that he needs a loan to buy the personal use items needed to fill all the orders his customers have placed.

In this way his business will continue growing and he will continue generating extra income so that his two children will be able to enjoy a better quality of life and greater economic opportunities for making progress.  Edgar dreams with raising his two children and giving them a good education and economic stability that will allow them to get ahead in the future.

loans.use: to buy personal use items to sell.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her pranda-making business. Prandas are used to tie women’s hair and are a very famous product. With the loan investment, she will buy required materials like colored thread and beads in larger quantity and of better quality. That will allow her to make prandas in larger quantity and to make more profits from her business. 

She is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for the past many years. She is very hopeful that a loan investment will be more productive for her. 

Her husband is illiterate and operates a food stall in the community market, where he sells nan chanay (a famous dish made with chick-peas and served with bread). The taste of his dish is very good and he makes good money from his business. 

Razia is the mother of an 18-year-old son who has studied until eighth grade and currently remains at home. 

She is very hopeful about her family’s better future as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy required materials for her pranda-making business.

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is a 42 year-old seamstress and sews beautiful-looking clothes for her neighborhood clients. She learned these skills from her mother before marriage and now she earns good profits from her work. Due to her good quality work, she receives regular orders every month.  Her husband sells wheat. He supplies the wheat to different wholesale dealers and earns a profit on it. He handles a good client base.  Khursheed has given birth to 6 children. All of them are associated with different kinds of work to financially contribute to the family. 

Khursheed has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy wheat in larger quantity for reselling at a profit. He is very experienced in his business, and Khursheed is confident that her husband’s business will become more successful after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy wheat for reselling

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a very efficient and hardworking lady. She remains at her home and does her household responsibilities. She tries her best to provide comfort to her family with her efforts. Her family regards her efforts and respects her a lot.   
Her husband is a butcher by profession and operates a meat shop in the community where he specifically deals with chickens. He handles a good clientele base who come to him for purchasing chicken meat. He sells fresh quality meat to the customers with perfect measurement.   

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy chickens in larger quantity which will allow him to fulfill the client orders on time, particularly for weddings and other parties.  He is very experienced in his work and has been operating it for the past many years.  Razia is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for him.

loans.use: To buy chickens for meat business

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina es una persona muy trabajadora que junto con su esposo han logrado sacar su familia adelante y progresar a pesar de todas las adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida. Desde hace un largo tiempo trabaja como mayordomo de una finca junto con su esposo, y con el ánimo de generar ingresos extras para ofrecer a su hijo una buena educación decidió montar su negocio de venta de productos de uso personal, donde ofrece prendas de vestir, bolsos, calzado, entre otros productos más, y gracias a este negocio ha tenido la oportunidad de generar ingresos extras para su familia y así tener una mejor calidad de vida. Con su negocio ya lleva cerca de 5 años y en este tiempo ha logrado crecer sus ventas considerablemente, y esto le ha permitido tener cada vez más reconocimiento en las personas del sector, lo que ha hecho que sus pedidos cada vez se incrementen más. Con el ánimo de responder a los pedidos de sus clientes, y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital para ello, Luz Marina busca que un préstamo le permita comprar productos de uso personal con los cuales pueda responder a todos los pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.
De esta manera su negocio seguirá creciendo y así podrá seguir generando ingresos extras con los cuales pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida en su hogar. Además, Luz Marina sueña con tener un gran negocio posicionado y desde el cual le pueda ofrecer a su hijo una estabilidad económica que le permita progresar en un futuro.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a very hardworking person who, along with her husband, has managed to help her family get ahead despite the adversities that life has given them. She and her husband have been working as foremen on a farm for a long time. However, with the hopes of generating extra income so that she can provide her son with a good education, she decided to launch her own business, selling products like apparel, bags, footwear, and others. Thanks to this business, she has had the opportunity to make extra money for her family, thus allowing for a better quality of life. She has been in business for 5 years, and in that time, she has witnessed her sales increase considerably. This has allowed her to get more and more attention from people in the area, which in turn has increased sales even more. Because she wants to fill orders and because she does not have the capital to do so, Luz Marina is now requesting a loan that will allow her to purchase more merchandise to meet customer demand.

Thus, her business will continue growing, and she will be able to make extra money to give her family a better quality of life. Furthermore, Luz Marina dreams of having a well-established business so that she can offer her son the financial stability that will allow him to succeed in the future.

loans.use: to purchase products and fill her customer's orders.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s shoe making business.  With the loan, he will buy leather, shoe laces and nails for making a larger quantity of shoes. This will help him to fulfill larger orders on time, and it will improve his income. 

Azra is educated through the twelfth standard. She has a job in an insurance company. She has great marketing skills and works very hard to financially support her family.  She has given birth to 5 children. All but her youngest son are attending the local school.  She is very confident about the future business success of her husband as a result of a loan investment.

loans.use: To buy materials for shoe making business

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en:
Shakir is a 57 year-old married man with three sons.  Shakir has been breeding calves and cows for last 20 years. After several attempts to find job, he gave up and decided to start his business. With the help of his wife, they purchased their first cattle.

Shakir usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar.  His monthly income is 300 AZN and this business is the only source of income in his family.  Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Shakir also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.  His wife helps him to look after the cattle. 

He wants to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family. He applied for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase two calves, one milk cow and fodder.  This will be his second loan from AqroInvest CU, and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy two calves, one milk cow and fodder

loans.name: Zahid

texts.en:
Zahid is married and raising two children. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives in Bilasuvar. Zahid buys and sells livestock and he currently has three head of livestock on his farm. His livestock business is the only source of income for the family and his monthly income is 250 AZN. 

Zahid is requesting a 1,000 AZN loan to expand his business and buy livestock and animal feed. He is a very  hardworking person and this will be his second loan from AqroInvest and Kiva. Zahid thanks everyone for the offered support.

loans.use: to buy livestock and animal feed

loans.name: Dunyaxanim

texts.en:
Dunyaxanim is a 55 year-old widow who raises her daughter alone.  She is a market vendor and sells food products like macaroni, beverages, sugar, candies and cookies. She has12 years of experience in this field, which makes her a knowledgeable and skilled person. Her products  are very popular among women. Dunyaxanim is always friendly and polite with her customers, which makes her business successful. Her monthly profit is 230 AZN.  As this business is the only income source, Dunyaxanim`s daughter helps her with business. 

Dunyaxanim would like to expand her business and purchase more merchandise and diversify the range of producst she sells. For this purpose, she applied for 1000 AZN.  She has a positive loan history.  This will be her 6th loan, and she promises to pay back on time.

loans.use: to buy more food products

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
Gloria es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de su único hijo a quien siempre le ha querido brindar una buena calidad de vida y por quien siempre se esfuerza en su trabajo para sacarlo adelante. Gloria tiene una venta de productos de uso personal a través de catálogo como lo son lociones, cremas de manos, cosméticos, entre otros, y gracias a esto genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de todos los gastos de su hogar. En su negocio ya lleva un buen tiempo y poco a poco ha venido creciendo en ventas, lo que le ha permitido brindarle a su hijo el acceso a una mejor educación. En la actualidad tiene grandes pedidos de sus clientes por atender, y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital, Gloria busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de uso personal con los cuales pueda responder a los grandes pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.

De esta manera podrá seguir creciendo en su negocio y ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio. Además, Gloria espera que su hijo tenga la oportunidad de acceder a una mejor educación y brindarle un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
Gloria is a single mother and head of the household who has always wanted to provide her only son with a good quality of life and who always does her best to get ahead. 

Gloria sells personal care products from a catalog such as lotions, hand creams, cosmetics, and other items and thanks to this she generates the necessary income to cover all the household expenses. She has been in business for some time and little by little her sales have increased which has permitted her to give her son access to a better education. 

Because currently she has numerous orders to cater to and because she does not have a lot of capital, Gloria is searching for a loan to provide the possibility of buying personal care products so she can fulfill these orders from her customers. In this way she can continue expanding her business and offer her clientele good service. 

Also, Gloria hopes that her son has the opportunity to have a better education and she wants to provide him with a stable economic future.

loans.use: to buy personal care products in order to meet the large orders that her clients have made

loans.name: Norma
