loans.use: to pay for calves and greenhouse construction

loans.name: Flora Maria

texts.es: Flora  de 64  años vive  (isla  Guayaquil). Ella  decidió entrar a este negocio porque es una buena manera de tener dinero para poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Este negocio  es de poner un restaurante  comenzó hace 3 años porque decidió independizarse y no ser mas empleada. Le gusta y le va bien gracias a Dios. Trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de su hija  . La dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia. a futuro anhela tener su negocio grande y tener en buen estado su casa  . Con el préstamo comprara (congelador)
texts.en:
Flora is 64 years old and lives in Guayaquil Island. She started her business, as it was a good way to provide her children with the necessities they require. This is a restaurant business. She decided to begin this business three years ago so she wouldn’t be an employee any more. She likes the work and the business is going well, thanks to God. She works every day with the help of her daughter. It is difficult when she can’t be at work. Her dream for the future is to have a larger business and a home in good repair.
With this loan she will buy a freezer

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Vorn, 66, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in fishing for more than ten years, earning approximately USD 8 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Vorn is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase will help her carry fish to sell as well. In the future, she would like to purchase farmland for growing rice to generate extra income to support her family and help her child get a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel   de 41  años vive  (playas  Guayaquil). El decidió entrar a este negocio porque es una buena manera de tener dinero para poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Este negocio  es la venta de ropa playera comenzó vendiendo ceviche en la playa luego decidió vender ropa playera en el malecón de playas. Le gusta y le va bien gracias a Dios. Trabaja todos los días solo  su esposa lo dejo   tiene hijos y quiere darle todo lo que necesiten sus hijos. La dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia. a futuro anhela tener su negocio grande y tener su casa en buen estado . Con el préstamo comprara ( ropa )
texts.en: Manuel is 41 years old and lives in Playas (Guayaquil). He decided to go into this business because it is a good way to have money to be able to give the necessities to his children. His business is selling beach clothing. He began selling ceviche on the beach, then he decided to sell beach clothing on the  boardwalk at the beach. He liked it, and it is going well for him, thanks to God. He works alone every day. His wife left him. He has children and wants to give them everything they need. The difficulty that he has is crime. In the future he wants to have a large business and to have his house in good condition. With the loan he will buy clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy beach clothing to sell

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
With his long experience in farming, Antonio shares that his expertise in the field is continually improving. Antonio has managed his rice farming business for more than 20 years. He is married and has four children as the fruit of love with his wife. Antonio’s wife is engaged in a tailoring business. His wife's income from the business is used for daily consumption in the household.

Antonio encounters difficulties in fulfilling his needs in farming. Thus, he needs financial support to meet these needs.  He has decided to seek a loan of  PHP 27,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farm. Antonio hopes to receive the loan as it would be beneficial for him in maintaining his business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is 36 years old. She lives in Aygestan village with her husband, pensioner mother-in-law and two sons. Anush's husband, Albert is 43 and works at the local school. Her two sons, Artur and Arman, are 16 and 18 and are both involved in the agricultural business. Anush and her husband are also involved in agriculture. They run a farm, where they grow potatoes, corn, greens and grapes. 
Anush wants to purchase 60 poles for the grape trees, as they are growing year by year. With the loan's help she will also purchase 100 saplings of apple and fertilizer. This will allow Anush to develop her farm and have a stable source of income for her and her sons' families in the future.

loans.use: to pay for poles for grape trees, apple saplings and fertilizer

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um is 44 years old and a humble villager from Batey district, Kompong Cham province. She has a common-law relationship with her husband; they both work as rice farmers. She has been in this business for many years. For additional income, Um owns and operates a grocery shop selling beef soup with vegetables in her neighborhood. Now she is responsible for three single children, two of whom are employed and work in the construction field.

To satisfy the family's living needs, Um would like to take out a loan of USD 400.00 to purchase a used motorcycle for home use. This will enable her family to avoid paying for motor-taxi service as they have previously. In the future, Um wants to expand her grocery shop and save some money to buy an extra plot of farmland to increase her rice production.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for home use.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco  de 24  años vive  (isla   Guayaquil). El decidió entrar a este negocio porque es una buena manera de tener dinero para poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Este negocio  es la venta de frutas. Le gusta y le va bien gracias a Dios. Trabaja todos los días  con la ayuda de su esposa  tiene hijos y quiere darle todo lo que necesiten sus hijos. La dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia. a futuro anhela tener su negocio grande y tener a una familia unida . Con el préstamo comprara (mercadería  frutas)
texts.en: Marco is 24 years old. He lives in Isla, Guayaquil. He decided to go into this business because it is a good way to have money to be able to give his children the necessities. His business is selling fruit. He likes it, and it is going well for him, thanks to God. He works every day with the help of his wife. He has children and wants to give them everything they need. The difficulty that he has is crime. In the future, he wants to have a bigger business and to have a united family. With the loan he will buy fruit to sell.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Ashrf

texts.en:
Ashrf is 31 years old, married and lives with his two children. He has owned a grocery store for one year where he sells basic household necessities such as beans, milk, eggs, soap, and other items. His store is very well known in the area and has a lot of customers, as everything he sells is excellent quality and priced affordably--besides, the service is exceptional. 

Ashrf is an enterprising man, always ready to work to improve himself and succeed in the future. He thinks we gain strength from what we learn to overcome. He decided to apply for a loan that will allow him to buy staple grains, instant products, candy, drinks, etc. He has faith that in this way, he will be able to give his family a better quality of life. In the future, he would like to expand his business as well as buy a bus in order to transport his goods from market to his business smoothly.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, instant products, candy, drinks, etc for his business

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein, 52 years old, is a married man. He has two daughters.

Hussein has been working in the distribution business for almost 12 years. After getting some experience, Hussein has decided to start his own business in the same field, and he chose to distribute cosmetic products mostly to beauty salons.

Now Hussein has applied for this loan to increase the inventory he has and add new brands to expand his distribution area, thereby improving the business level.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of cosmetics products

loans.name: Grace Jasmin

texts.es: Grace  de 21  años vive  (playas   Guayaquil). Ella decidió entrar a este negocio porque es una buena manera de tener dinero para poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Este negocio que  tener una peluquería  comenzó vendiendo cosméticos pero después decidió ponerse su propio gabinete de belleza porque estudio para  estilista. Le gusta y le va bien gracias a Dios. Trabaja todos los días sola  es  madre soltera. La dificultad que tiene es la del.incuencia. a futuro anhela tener su negocio grande y tener a una familia unida . Con el préstamo comprara ( tintes )
texts.en: Grace is 21 years old. She lives in Playas, Guayaquil. She decided to go into this business because it is a good way to have money to be able to give the necessities to her children. Her business is a beauty salon. She began selling cosmetics but then she decided to set up her own beauty salon because she studied to be a stylist. She likes it, and it is going well for her, thanks to God. She works every day. She is a single mother. The difficulty that she has is crime. In the future she wants to have a bigger business and have a united family. With the loan she will buy dyes.

loans.use: to buy dyes

loans.name: Shaima

texts.en:
Shaima, 35 years old, is a married woman. Her husband works in a governmental entity. They have two daughters.

Shaima has been in the food retail business for a while. She started by selling olive oil and cheese. From her profit, she was able to open a mini-market to sell different types of food products, snacks and candy.

Now Shaima has applied for this loan to bring in missing food products to her store so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To add more food products to her store

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia, 37 years old, is a married woman. She has one son and one daughter.

Nadia has always been into making baskets and designing mirrors as a hobby. Recently, she thought of turning her hobby into a business to make an additional income for the family.
  
Now Nadia has been framing mirrors, making baskets, and framing paintings. She also started to make wooden boxes.
 
Nadia has applied for this loan to start working on expanding the business and to start making larger quantities so she can distribute to the decoration stores in the market.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making straw baskets

loans.name: Azganush

texts.en: Azganush is 57 years old. She lives in Ararat town. Two years ago, Azganush started her own business of selling food. As a woman with initiative, she has been running the business successfully and now wants to develop it further. Azganush has applied for this loan to develop her shop. With the requested amount, she will purchase more food and increase the product variety in the shop. This loan will help Azganuh to increase her business income and invest in its further expansion.

loans.use: to pay for food for her shop

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y siempre querer ofrecerle a su familia una buena calidad de vida, es por esto que se esfuerza diariamente en su taller de cerrajería para buscar mejores oportunidades económicas para su hogar. Desde hace aproximadamente 40 años viene trabajando en la actividad de la cerrajería, pues desde muy temprana edad la aprendió y consiguió un empleo durante un largo tiempo desempeñando esta actividad. Debido a que consideraba que su empleo no estaba siendo bien remunerado decidió montar su propio taller de cerrajería, y ya lleva unos 22 años trabajando en su propio negocio brindándole a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En su taller ofrece a sus clientes productos como puertas, ventanas, rejas, artículos decorativos, entre otros, y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha logrado tener muy buenas ventas. Con el ánimo de renovar su maquinaria, Orlando busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de comprar una máquina pulidora ya que con la que cuenta en su taller se encuentra obsoleta. 

De esta manera su negocio seguirá ofreciendo un buen trabajo a sus clientes y así podrá seguir teniendo buenas ventas mensuales. Orlando sueña con poder sacar su esposa y sus 2 hijos adelante, brindándoles una buena educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Orlando has always considered himself to be very hardworking and wants to give his family a good quality of life. For that reason he puts in effort every day in his locksmith's shop, seeking better financial opportunities for his household. He's been working in this trade for about 40 years. He learned from a very early age and kept his job for a long time. Due to the fact that his job didn't pay well, he decided to start his own locksmith workshop and has been doing that for 22 years, improving his family's quality of life. In his workshop he offers products like doors, windows, bars, decorative items and other things, and thanks to the quality of his work he has very good sales. With the desire to upgrade his machinery, Orlando is seeking a loan to buy a new polishing machine because the one in his shop is obsolete.

This way he will continue to offer good work to his customers and can keep his monthly sales up. Orlando dreams of being able to take care of his wife and 2 children, giving them a good university education.

loans.use: to buy a polishing machine because his is obsolete.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora, y esta cualidad le ha permitido sacar sus 3 hijos adelante como madre soltera cabeza de familia. Beatriz hace poco tiempo montó un negocio para generar sus ingresos luego de haber dejado su empleo; el negocio es una papelería y allí ofrece a sus clientes un muy buen servicio. Debido a que el negocio fue montado con muy bajo capital Beatriz espera que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de papelería para surtir su negocio y ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Su negocio, a pesar del corto tiempo de estar montado, ya puede generar un empleo para una persona y espera que su negocio siga creciendo para seguir generando más empleo para los más necesitados. Además, Beatriz sueña con que este negocio le genere unos buenos ingresos con los cuales sus 3 hijos puedan gozar de una buena calidad de vida y el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a person who has always been known for being a hard worker. This quality has enabled her three children to move forward since she is a single mother and the head of her household. A short time ago, Beatriz established her business so that she could generate income after leaving her job. She manages a stationery shop where she offers her customer excellent service. Her business was started with very little capital, so Beatriz is taking this opportunity to access a loan so that she can buy paper products to restock her business and provide a wider variety of products to her customers.

Even though her business has been in existence for a short time, Beatriz has been able to hire one employee. She hopes that her business continues to grow so that she can create more jobs to those who need them the most. In addition, she dreams that this business generates good income so that her children can enjoy a good quality of life and have access to a high-quality education.

loans.use: to buy paper products to sell.

loans.name: Lauro

texts.es: Lauro, es un hombre muy trabajador que se dedica a la siembra y venta de rosas de varios colores, su terreno es grande y tiene la mayor parte de plantación en rosas y algunas gladiolas. El cuenta que con el apoyo y amor incondicional de su esposa e hijos ha logrado muchos sueños y metas que se ha propuesto. El dice que al iniciar trabajar con la fundación invirtió  el capital en en la siembra de gladiolas, ahora que ya conoce a FAPE desea solicitar un capital más grande para poder invertir en el cultivo de rosas  ya que  los fertilizantes y abonos han subido de precio no le alcanza el dinero que  tiene para comprar, el tiene algunas personas trabajando con él,  las cual se dedican a  podar y cuidar las siembras de rosa contra las plagas, y se encargan de riego  y corte de rosa.  El dice estar muy contento por el resultado de la venta de rosas, porque han  aumentado los pedidos  y  ha  mejorado  el precio de venta.    El  da  gracias a Dios por abrirle las puertas en FAPE y KIVA y a todas las personas que hacen posible que  lo apoyen con un crèdito,  no importando la distancia en que se encuentren.  Les manda muchos agradecimientos por confiar en personas como él que se encuentran lejos y sin conocerlos y le pide a Dios bendiciones para cada uno de ustedes.
texts.en:
Lauro is a hardworking gentleman who grows and sells roses of various colors. His plot of land is large and most of it is designated for growing roses and a few gladiolas. Lauro has the support and unconditional love of his wife and children. He has many dreams and goals that he wants to accomplish. When he started working with FAPE, Lauro said that he invested his capital in the cultivation of gladiolas. Now that he is known by the organization, he wants to request a larger loan so that he can invest in the cultivation of roses. The price of fertilizers and compost have increased, but he does not have the money to purchase these items. Lauro has a few employees who work with him. They are charged with protecting the rose bushes from pests, irrigation, and pruning. He says that he is very pleased with the results he has obtained from selling roses because his orders have increased and he is able to charge a higher sales price.

Lauro says that he thanks God that the doors to FAPE and Kiva have been opened to as many people as possible so that they can access loans without any regard to distance. He sends his appreciation to those who have trusted complete strangers and low-income people like him and asks for God's blessing to be granted on each one of them.

loans.use: to buy compost for growing flowers.

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Jhonathan

texts.es:
Jhonathan es un joven emprendedor que desde hace aproximadamente unos 6 meses decidió montar su propio negocio con el ánimo de generar sus propios ingresos y contribuir económicamente en su hogar. A través de una compañera de estudios, Jhonathan aprendió a vender productos de uso personal, los cuales los ofrece a sus familiares, vecinos y demás personas del sector, y gracias a esto ha logrado montar su propio negocio. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes y tener muy buenos niveles de ventas. Con el ánimo de seguir aumentando sus ventas, Jhonathan busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de uso personal para ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y así aumentar sus ventas.

De esta manera, Jhonathan atraerá más clientes a su negocio y podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio. Además, con mayores ingresos su familia podrá gozar de una mejor calidad de vida gracias a los aportes de Jhonathan y también se podrá seguir pagando sus estudios.
texts.en:
Jhonathan is a young entrepreneur who started his business approximately six months ago. He was eager to generate his own income and contribute financially to his household. He learned about selling personal use products from a classmate and now he sells to relatives, neighbors, and people who live in the area. Thanks to what he has learned, Jhonathan was able to establish his business. The good quality of his products enables him to attract a large number of customers and achieve a high level of sales. In an effort to increase his sales, Jhonathan seeks the opportunity to access a loan so that he can buy personal use products. This will enable him to offer a wider variety of merchandise and increase his sales.

Jhonathan hopes to attract more customers to his business and provide them with better service. By earning more income, his family will enjoy a better quality of life. He will also be able to continue paying for his studies.

loans.use: to buy personal use products.

loans.name: Rukundo Group

texts.fr:
Pascasie  fait partie du groupe Rukundo et   habite à Gitega. Elle  a 34 ans et est mariée à Cyprien,  un agent d'une société d’assurance(Socabu). Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants,  dont  3 étudient à l’école primaire et deux autres en maternelle.

Elle fait le commerce d’habits  depuis  10ans. 

Elle est à son sixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits qui lui généreront d’autres  bénéfices. 

Grâce à ces bénéfices, elle parvient à satisfaire les besoins de la famille, et participe dans la construction de la maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Pascasie lives in Gitega and is a member of the Rukundo group.  She is 34 years old and married to Cyprien, who works for an insurance company (Socabu).  They have six children together.  Three of their children are in elementary school and two are in nursery school.

Pascasie has been selling clothes for the past ten years.  This is her sixth loan with Turame.  With her Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of clothes which will allow her to make additional profits.

Thanks to her profits, Pascasie manages to take care of her family's needs and contributes to the construction of their home.

loans.use: to increase her capital in order to buy a large quantity of clothes and make more profits.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco aprendió la actividad de la elaboración de artesanías en barro por parte de su padre quien antes era el encargado del taller y le enseñó la actividad desde muy temprana edad. Cuando su padre murió, Francisco quedó a cargo del taller y desde esto viene trabajando fuertemente para sacar el negocio adelante. Francisco se ha caracterizado por hacer productos de buena calidad y esto le ha permitido tener una gran cantidad de clientes. Gracias a que tiene grandes pedidos por entregar, Francisco busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de barro para tener la materia prima con la cual elaborar las artesanías en barro y hacer entrega de los pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.

De esta manera su negocio seguirá saliendo adelante y podrá seguir teniendo los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco learned how to make handicrafts out of clay from his father, who had managed his own workshop. He learned this trade at a very young age. When his father died, Francisco took over his father's shop and worked hard to make his business a success. He is known for making products that are of good quality, which has enabled him to gain a large number of customers. As a result of the large numbers of orders he must complete, Francisco is seeking the opportunity to access a loan so that he can buy clay. This is the main material that he uses to make the handicrafts and fulfill his customers' orders.

Francisco's business enables him to continue moving forward and earning the necessary income to support his family.

loans.use: to buy clay for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Amna Mai's Group

texts.en:
Amna Mai is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of nine children; seven daughters and two sons. Five of her children are getting their education while the others are free and don’t do anything.  

Amna and her husband are by nature very hard-working persons. They own and operate an animal sales business. Their work is home based. Amna’s husband purchases the animals from an animal market and sells to the required customers for a profit.  

Amna has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for their animal sales business. They will invest the loan to buy an animal (buffalo) to sell. They are very confident that their business will return them good earnings after this loan investment.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is thirty-two years old. She lives in Kajaran city, in the south of Armenia, with her husband, son and daughter. Margarita's husband works at the local copper foundry. For two years already the couple has been keeping beehives. During this period they managed to increase the number of beehives and now have nine beehives. 

Margarita has applied for this loan to develop their beekeeping. With the requested amount she will purchase twenty-six beehives. This will allow Margarita to gather more honey, which she sells in Kajaran and Kapan cities, and get more income. With the additional income Margarita will renovate her house and create better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to pay for beehives.

loans.name: Haknazar

texts.ru: Хакназару 46 лет, у него 4 детей, 3  сына и 1 дочь. Сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2009 года. На рынке он работает почти 6 лет, торгуя различными тканями. Сейчас у него начинается летний сезон продаж тканей, и торговля идет хорошо. Поэтому он планирует на полученный кредит привезти широкий ассортимент товара. Его занятие является основным доходом для семьи, так как его жена нигде не работает и занимается домашним хозяйством и воспитанием  детей. Хакназар выражает свою благодарность нашей организации за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Haknazar is 46 years old, he has four children: three sons and one daughter. He has been collaborating with out organization since 2009. He has been working on the market for almost six years selling different fabrics. Right now the summer season has started and the sales are good. This is why Haknazar plans to use the received loan to bring in a wide variety of goods. His business is the only source of income for his family because his wife is not working and stays as home as a homemaker and looks after the children. Haknazar expresses his gratitude for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy seasonal variety of fabrics.

loans.name: Varditer

texts.en:
Varditer is fifty-five years old. She lives in Artashat town with her thirty-four-year-old daughter, Gohar. For fifteen years Gohar has been involved in agriculture. She cultivates a land of 0.43 hectares, where she grows barley. Varditer also buys chickens every year, keeps them for a year, and then sells them. 

Now Varditer needs additional financing to continue the poultry business. With the help of the loan, she will purchase 5,000 chickens and food for them. 

This loan will help Varditer to make savings and  develop her farm by cultivating different types of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Heghine

texts.en:
Heghine is forty-two years old. She lives in Mrganush village with her husband and daughter. Heghine and her husband have been running a farm for twelve years already. It is the main source of income for the family. They grow grapes, tomatoes, beans, cabbage and alfalfa. 

Heghine needs sufficient financial means to cultivate the land. With the help of the loan, she plans to purchase tomatoes, alfalfa seeds, fertilizer and poles for the grape orchard. This is important to allow Heghine to continue successfully running the farm and develop it further.

loans.use: to pay for tomatos, alfalfa seeds, fertilizer and poles.

loans.name: Shokir

texts.ru: Шокир – 32 года, не женат. Сотрудничает с нашей организацией более двух лет. Он торгует на рынке противопожарными и хозяйственными товарами. Опыт в этой сфере торговли около 8 лет. Шокир - единственный сын в семье. У него пожилая мать за которой он ухаживает. Его деятельность является основным доходом для семьи. На полученный кредит хочет расширить ассортимент товаров и увеличить свой товарооборот. Увеличив прибыль он хочет с каждого дохода откладывать деньги на свадьбу. Шокир выражает свою благодарность нашей организации за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Shokir is 32 years old and single.  He has been cooperating with our organization for more than two years.  He sells household and fire-prevention goods at the market, and has almost eight years of experience in this field.

Shokir is the only son in his family.  His mother is getting older and he cares for her.  His business provides the main source of income for the family.  With his loan, he wants to expand his assortment of merchandise and increase his product turnover.  With increased profits, he would like to regularly put some money aside for his wedding. 

Shokir expresses his gratitude toward our organization for the financial support it provides.

loans.use: to expand his assortment of goods and his business.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Adjo est une femme âgée de 33 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur. Elle a 4 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 15 ans et le dernier a 7 ans.
Adjo travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle vend des céréales et des tubercules d’igname pour tous clients à la maison. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir acheter en grande quantité pour satisfaire tous ses clients.
Adjo a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du maïs et des tubercules d’ignames. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Adjo voudrait devenir grossiste. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adjo is a 33-year-old woman. She is married to a retailer. She has four children, all of whom attend school. The oldest is 15 and the youngest is 7.
Adjo has worked as a retailer since 2007. She sells cereals and yams to all types of customers at her home. She buys her products in Lomé. She works by herself. At the moment, her main difficulty is being unable to buy in enough quantity to satisfy all her customers.
Adjo has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy maize and yams. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Adjo would like to become a wholesaler. She says that with the profits, she foresees ensuring her children's education.

loans.use: To buy yams and bags of maize.

loans.name: Tiguénna

texts.fr:
Tiguenna est une femme âgée de 32 ans. Elle est marié å un imprimeur. Elle a 3 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 9 ans et le dernier a 4 ans.
Tiguenna travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle vend des habits prêt à porter pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir satisfaire toute les demandes.
Tiguenna a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des prêts à porter. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Tiguenna voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité et ouvrir une seconde boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de contribuer à l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Tiguenna is a 32-year-old woman. She is married to a printer. She has three children, all of whom attend school. The oldest is 9 and the youngest is 4.
Tiguenna has worked as a retailer since 2005. She sells ready-to-wear clothing to all types of customers at her shop. She buys her products in Lomé. She works by herself. At the moment, her main difficulty is being unable to satisfy her customers' demands.
Tiguenna has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy ready-to-wear clothing. She wants to reinvest in her business.
In the coming years, TIguenna would like to expand the size of her business and open a second shop. She says that with the profits, she intends to contribute to her family's successful development.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Aboudramani

texts.fr:
Aboudramani est un homme âgé de 36 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 3 enfants qui vont à l’école. Le premier a 15 ans et le dernier a 7 ans.
Aboudramani travaille comme mécanicien et revendeur depuis 1997. Il vend de l’huile à moteur pour tous clients. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire tout le monde.
Aboudramani a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de l’huile à moteur. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Aboudramani voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité en passant des commandes importantes. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit  d’augmenter le niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aboudramani is a 36-year-old man. He is married to a retailer. He has three children who attend school. The oldest is 15 and the youngest is 7.
Aboudramani has worked as a mechanic and retailer since 1997. He sells motor oil to all types of customers. He buys his products in Lomé. He works by himself. At the moment, his main difficulty is being unable to satisfy everyone.
Aboudramani has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy motor oil. He wants to reinvest in his business.
In the coming years, Aboudramani would like to expand the size of his business by fulfilling large orders. He says that with the profits, he intends to raise his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy and re-sell motor oil.

loans.name: Dani

texts.fr:
Dani est une femme âgée de 32 ans. Elle est célibataire et a un enfant de 10 ans qui va à l’école.
Dani travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2010. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes de ses clients.
Dani a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Dani voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Dani is a 32-year-old woman. She is unmarried and has a 10-year-old child who attends school.
Dani has worked as a retailer since 2010. She sells basic food products to all types of customers at her shop. She buys her products in Lomé. She works by herself. At the moment, her main difficulty is being unable to satisfy all the demands of her customers.
Dani has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy basic food products. She wants to reinvest in her business.
In the coming years, Dani would like to expand the size of her business. She says that with the profits, she intends to ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: To buy basic food products

loans.name: Lyudmila

texts.en:
Lyudmila is 39 years old. She lives in Shaghat village with her husband, son and father-in-law. Lyudmila works at the local school as a teacher of biology. Besides that, she is involved in agriculture. Seven years ago the family founded a farm and has continually developed it during the last few years by building a barn and a fishpond. They also cultivate the land, where they grow potatoes and beans. 

Lyudmila has applied for this loan to develop the farm. In particular, she plans to purchase fish and feed for them, as well as potato seeds and fertilizer to start the land cultivation.

This loan will allow Lyudmila to earn more income, renovate her house and create more prosperous conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer, fish and feed for the fish

loans.name: Akpédzé

texts.fr:
Akpedze est une femme âgée de 33 ans. Elle est célibataire et à un enfant de 8ans qui va à l’école.
Akpedze travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2004. Elle vend des tissus et de la bonneterie pour tous clients à la maison. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Akpedze a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des tissus et de la bonneterie. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Akpedze voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akpedze is a 33-year-old woman. She is unmarried and has an 8-year-old child who attends school.
Akpedze has worked as a retailer since 2004. She sells fabric and hosiery to all types of customers at her house. She buys her products in Lomé. She works by herself. At the moment, her main difficulty is a shortage in her stock of goods.
Akpedze has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy fabric and hosiery. She wants to reinvest in her business.
In the coming years, Akpedze would like to open a shop. She says that with the profits, she intends to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy pagnes (brightly-printed West African clothing), fabric, and hosiery.

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr:
Amivi est une femme âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur. Elle a 2 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 11 ans et le dernier a 8 ans.
Amivi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2002. Elle vend du charbon de bois pour tous clients à Lomé. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Amivi a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Amivi voudrait diversifier son activité en vendant aussi des céréales. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amivi is a 39-year-old woman. She is married to a retailer. She has two children, both of whom attend school. The elder is 11 and the younger is 8.
Amivi has worked as a retailer since 2002. She sells charcoal to all types of clients in Lomé. She buys her products in Lomé. She works by herself. At the moment, her main difficulty is a shortage in her stock of goods.
Amivi has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy charcoal. She wants to reinvest in her business.
In the coming years, Amivi would like to diversify her business by also selling cereals. She says that with the profits, she intends to take care of her family.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 50 years old. She lives in Goravan village with her family; her 51-year-old husband, 23-year-old daughter and 24-, 25-  and 27-year-old sons. Anahit's husband works at a stone production factory, her daughter works at a chemistry shop, and her sons also have their own jobs. Nevertheless, agriculture in land cultivation and cattle breeding plays an important role for the family's income. 

Anahit has applied for this loan to develop the farm. With the requested amount she will purchase sheep and construct a new barn, where there will be comfortable conditions for raising cattle. 

Development of agriculture is important for Anahit to insure financial stability for her family and support her children's families in the future.

loans.use: to pay for barn construction and sheep

loans.name: Nazeli

texts.en:
Nazeli is 26 years old. She lives in Dalar village with her mother-in-law and two little children. The main source of income for the family comes from agriculture. In addition, Nazeli cooks bread and sells it to the local shops. 

Nazeli would like to develop farming by constructing a greenhouse, which will allow her to grow more fruit and vegetables. Nazeli also plans to purchase fertilizer for the land cultivation. Nazeli is very optimistic about farming and hopes to earn more income, which will help her to insure financial stability for her children.

loans.use: to pay for green house construction and fertilizer

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en: Marieta is 29 years old. She lives in Khndzoresk village with her husband, son and 3 daughters. Marieta and her husband run a farm, where they cultivate land and raise cattle; 4 cows and 4 calves. Marieta wants to start land cultivation, for which she needs sufficient financial means. With the requested amount she plans to purchase seeds, fertilizer and fuel. This will allow Marieta to complete the land cultivation successfully and have a stable income for her family during the year.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Essowavana

texts.fr:
Essowavana est une femme âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée å un employé. Elle a 6 enfants, dont 2 à l’école. 
Essowavana travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1990. Elle vend de l’huile rouge, des céréales et du charbon de bois pour tous clients dans une gare routière. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir satisfaire tous ses clients.
Essowavana a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de l’huile rouge. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Essowavana voudrait développer son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Essowavana is a 39-year-old woman. She is married to a clerk. She has six children, two of whom attend school.
Essowavana has worked as a retailer since 1990. She sells red palm oil, cereals, and charcoal to all types of customers at a bus station. She buys her products in Lomé. She works by herself. At the moment, her main difficulty is being unable to satisfy all of her customers.
Essowavana has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy red palm oil. She wants to reinvest in her business.
In the coming years, Essowavana would like to develop her business. She says that with the profits, she intends to ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: To buy red palm oil, maize, and firewood.

loans.name: Hamidou

texts.fr: Monsieur  Hamidou est âgé de 24 ans. Il est  marié et exerce l’activité de commerce depuis 2 ans. Il exerce la vente de parfums,  une activité qu’il a choisi par nécessité dans le but  de gagner des revenus, pour subvenir a ses besoins et aider sa famille. Il est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC, il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour aménager son lieu de travail et acheter des parfums en vue de renforcer son stock. Le  financement  lui permettra de mieux attirer la clientèle, d’accroitre ses bénéfices  pour mieux entretenir sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. Hamidou is 24 years old. He is married and has run a business for two years. He sells perfumes, an activity he chose by necessity with the goal of earning an income to provide for himself and help his family. He is a member of a local branch of U-IMCEC, and is seeking a loan of 100,000 Frs in order to renovate his workplace and buy perfumes in order to strengthen his stock. This loan will allow him to better attract customers and increase his profits to better take care of his family.

loans.use: To renovate his workplace and buy perfume for resale.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard is 48 years old. She lives with her 51-year-old husband and two children: 13-year-old daughter and 15-year-old son, who both attend school. Alvard and her husband earn their living by cultivating land and raising cattle. 

Alvard has applied for this loan to cultivate the land. In particular, she needs fertilizer and medicine for the seeds of fruits and vegetables to protect them. This loan will allow Alvard to purchase the necessary fertilizer and medicine and expect a rich harvest for this year.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and medicine

loans.name: Viktorya

texts.en:
Viktorya is 55 years old. She lives with her husband and sons. The family is involved in cattle breeding and land cultivating, which has provided a stable income for them during the past 15 years.

Viktorya wants to construct a new barn, which will allow her to create more favorable conditions for the cattle. She also wants to purchase tomato seeds and fertilizer and start the land cultivation. 

To implement these goals Viktorya has applied for this loan. With the development of agriculture, Viktorya will increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for barn construction, tomato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Elizaveta

texts.en:
Elizaveta is 39 years old. She lives with her husband and sons. 

Elizaveta's husband works at the local village hall. However, the family gets its main income from cattle breeding. Elizaveta would like to expand her farm by purchasing more cattle. With the help of this loan she will purchase two cows and two pigs. 

This will allow Elizaveta to earn additional income, which she plans to use for the renovation of her house and insuring a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for pigs and cows

loans.name: Dukore I Group

texts.fr:
Jean  fait partie du groupe Dukore I  et  habite à Gitega. Il a 34 ans et est marié à Nadine, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  3 enfants,  dont 1 étudie en troisième primaire.

Il fait le commerce de boutique (riz,  haricot, Fanta,…) depuis 15ans.  

Il  est à son dix-septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter d’autres articles commerciaux de sa boutique, à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il espère réaliser de grands profits qu’ils lui permettront de construire une maison en ville.
texts.en:
Jean is a member of the "Dukore I" group and lives in Gitega. He is 34 years old and is married to Nadine, a farmer. The couple have 3 children together, one of whom is in the 3rd year of primary school.

Jean has run a store selling food products (rice, beans, Fanta, etc.) for 15 years. This is his 17th loan with Turame. The Kiva-sponsored loan he obtains will increase his capital and he will buy other commercial products to resell in his store, so that he can earn more money. In the years ahead, he hopes to make large profits which will enable him to build a house in town.

loans.use: to restock his grocery store.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 27 years old. She lives in Mrganush village with her 34-year-old husband. Anna works at a shop as a seller. Besides this, she is involved in farming: they grow peach and apricot trees. 

Anna would like to develop her farm. She wants to construct a greenhouse, which will allow her to cultivate fruits and vegetables all year round. This is important, as it will allow Anna to have a stable income and make savings for the further development of agriculture.

loans.use: to pay for greenhouse construction

loans.name: Silvard

texts.en:
Silvard is 47 years old. She lives in Syunik village with her father and son. Silvard's son works at the local village hall. Silvard and her father are involved in cattle breeding. 

They have been running a farm for 10 years, which now includes 37 cows. Silvard has applied for this loan to increase the number of cattle. This will allow her to gather more milk, which she uses to make cheese. She then sells it on in the regional center, Kapan city. 

Silvard will increase her income from agriculture, which she plans to use to improve the conditions on her farm.

loans.use: to pay for cows

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea, 21, is single and resides with her mother and sister in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She and her sister have been working in a shoe factory for more than four years, earning approximately USD 7 per day. Chea wants to run an additional business in order to improve her family’s income. With this goal in mind, Chea is requesting a loan of USD 1,100 to purchase farmland to grow agricultural crops. 

This money will help her acquire the security to start this business and generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop at home to earn more income for the family. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to grow agricultural crops

loans.name: Phors

texts.en:
Phors, 41, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been running a tailoring shop for more than three years, earning approximately USD 11 per day. Her husband runs a public transportation service (motor taxi). He earns approximately USD 3 per day. One of her children is a tailor who earns about USD 5 per day. 

In order to improve her business, Phors is requesting a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase sewing machines to place in her shop. This purchase will help her provide a better service for her clients. 

In the future, she would like to purchase a store in the market to run the business and help her children get a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to purchase a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase sewing machines to place in her shop

loans.name: Tharan

texts.en:
Tharan, 40, is widowed and resides with her husband and daughter in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

She has been selling vegetables for more than ten years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her daughter is employed in a garment factory. She earns about USD 4 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Tharan is requesting a loan of USD 1,500 to raise capital in her business to purchase more vegetables to resell.

By doing so, she would be able to make more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to raise capital in her business to purchase more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Sear

texts.en:
Sear, 52, is married and resides with her husband and a grandchild in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in the agricultural business for more than twenty years. She has extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and fattening up animals. She earns approximately USD 4 per day. Her husband helps her to run the business. 

Sear wants to run an additional business in order to improve her family’s income. With this goal in mind, Sear is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase clothes to resell. This money will help her acquire the security to run a new business and earn extra income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business to make more profit for the family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng, 43, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in the agricultural business for more than ten years. She has extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up animals. She earns approximately USD 4 per day. Her husband helps her to run the business. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory and an electricity company. They earn about USD 6 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Heng would like to run an additional business. With this goal in mind, Heng requests a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service (motor taxi). This purchase would enable her husband to generate extra income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to run one more business, which involves animal husbandry and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient to her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service (motor taxi)

loans.name: Bariatou

texts.fr: Bariatou est une jeune dame de 22ans qui vend des produits de bonneteries  à toutes personnes de façon ambulante et au marché. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur et a 01 enfant de 07ans qui va à l’école. Elle a démarré en 2008 et sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. Elle veut augmenter son capital et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Bariatou is a 22-year-old woman who sells childcare products (childrens' shoes, creams, diapers, etc) on the street and at the market to all types of customers. She is married to a driver and has a 7-year-old child who goes to school.

Bariatou started her business in 2008 and is requesting this first loan from WAGES in order to restock on merchandise. She wishes to increase her capital and to ensure that her family flourishes.

loans.use: to buy childcare products

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Selah is 26 years old, married and has one child. He lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He has been operating a grocery store for five years.
 
He works hard so that he will be happy and have a good quality of life. He thinks that his business is going well because he provides good customer service.

Salah took a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy more merchandise for his store, in particular canned food, soft drinks, cakes and other things. This will give him a greater variety of products to offer and he will be able to continue fighting each day to achieve his dream of "having a big store and being a successful small businessman."

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for his store, especially canned food, soft drinks, cakes and other things

loans.name: Joffre Javier

texts.es: Javier    de 20   años vive (Quevedo   Guayaquil). El decidió entrar a este negocio porque es una buena manera de tener dinero para poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Este negocio  que es el vender verduras  comenzó de ayudante de venta de verduras luego se independizo le gusta y le va bien gracias a Dios. Trabaja todos los días sola es soltero. la dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia  . a futuro anhela tener su negocio grande y tener una familia  . Con el préstamo comprara (verduras )
texts.en: Javier is 20 years old. He lives in Quevedo, Guayaquil. He decided to go into his business because it is a good way to earn money to give his children what they need. His business is selling vegetables. He began as an assistant selling vegetables and later went off on his own. It is going well for him, thank God. He works alone every day and is single.  A difficulty he faces is crime. In the future he wants to have a big business and a family. With the loan, he will buy vegetables.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Susy Jacinta

texts.es: Susy de 47 años   de  años vive ( duran Guayaquil). Ella empezó este negocio con poca capital gracias a los prestamos fue incrementando su capital Y pudo poner su negocio que es la  la venta de comida .   Tiene su local en un lugar tranquilo donde no hay mucho peligro. Trabaja todos los días es soltera . A futuro anhela tener su negocio mejor . Con el préstamo comprara ( sillas mesas )
texts.en: Susy is 47 years old. She lives in the neighborhood of Duran in Guayaquil. She started this business with a little bit of capital thanks to loans and grew her business, which is selling food. She has a quiet locale where there isn't a lot of danger. She works every day and is single. In the future, she wants to improve her business. With the loan, she will buy tables and chairs.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Abiré

texts.fr: Agée de 43ans et mère de 03 enfants tous à l’école( le premier a 21ans et le dernier 11ans), Abiré est mariée à un militaire. Afin d’aider son mari dans les charges du ménage, elle a démarré en 2010 par vendre de la boisson locale et des savons à la maison. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé. Vu qu’elle manque de marchandises pour répondre aux besoins des clients, elle sollicite de WAGES ce  premier prêt pour acheter plus de marchandises. Elle veut avec les profits réalisés, réinvestir dans l’activité. Elle veut dans l’avenir la faire prospérer et assurer l’épanouissement de ses enfants.
texts.en: 43 years old and the mother of three children who are all in school (the eldest is 21 and the youngest 11 years old), Abiré is married to a soldier. In order to help her husband with the household expenses, in 2010 she began selling local drinks and soaps from her home. She buys her stock in Lomé. As she lacks merchandise that is sought after by her customers, she is seeking this first loan with WAGES in order to purchase more stock. She wants to reinvest the profits she makes into the business. In the future she wants to see the business prosper and to assure the development of her children.

loans.use: to buy soaps and local drinks.

loans.name: Donald Samuel

texts.es: Donald tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero, reside en  patuca, Olancho. El se dedica al cultivo y venta de café, negocio que lo aprendió trabajando con su papa, Donald poco a poco fue luchando hasta que hace  5 años pudo iniciar con su propio negocio, el horario de trabajo es de 5:00 am a 2:00 pm y cuando es la temporada de cosecha de café es a tiempo completo, siendo que el trabajo es abundante. Donald solicita este préstamo para invertirlo en la finca y en la compra de fertilizantes y así darle un mejor y adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo. El préstamo seria una muy buena oportunidad ya que de lo contrario tendría que comprometer la cosecha con intermediarios que le pagan el producto a un bajo precio. Uno de los problemas que enfrenta Donald es que en temporada de cosecha de café la mano de obra es escasa por lo que el trabajo se vuelve arduo y pesado. Su meta es tener mayor producción de café y con el apoyo del préstamo podrá sembrar más y su finca estará en mejores condiciones. Este es el primer préstamo que solicita en FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en: Donald is 29 years old. He is single and lives in Patuca, Olancho. He grows and sells coffee,a business he learned with his father. Donald struggled little by little until 5 years ago he was able to start his own business. His work schedule is from 5:00 am to 2:00 pm. When it is time to harvest the coffee he works all day, as there is a lot of work. Donald is asking for this loan to invest in his farm and buy fertilizers to give his crops adequate maintenance. The loan will be a good opportunity since without it he will have to sell his crop to middle men who will pay his a very low price for his product. One of the problems that Donald faces at harvest time is that workers are scarce and the work is heavy and difficult. Hs goal FAMA and he hopes to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Kanura I Group

texts.fr:
Therence fait partie du groupe Kanura I et habite à  Kayanza. Il  a 45 ans et est marié à  Sabine, cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants, dont 4 étudient:  deux àl’école primaire et deux autres au secondaire. Les enfants sont âgés de 4  à 13 ans.

Il fait le commerce d’habits  depuis 25ans. 

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d'habits à revendre,afin de gagner plus . 

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  construire sa propre maison et acheter une voiture.
texts.en:
Therence is part of the Kanura I group, and lives in Kayanza. He is 45 years of age and married to Sabine, a farmer. Together they have six children, four of whom study (two in elementary school and two in high school). The children are aged between 4 and 13.
For the past 25 years Therence has worked selling clothing. 
This is his third loan with Turame. He plans to use the money to expand his business and buy a lot of clothes to sell, therefore earning more money. 
Over the coming years Therence would like to build his own house and buy a car.

loans.use: to expand his business and buy a lot of clothes to sell, therefore earning more money.

loans.name: Kouamé

texts.fr:
Kouamé est un homme âgé de 42 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 02 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 07ans et le dernier 05ans.
Kouamé travaille comme chauffeur/ revendeur depuis 2010. Il vend des sacs de charbons de bois à la maison et est aidé par 01 personne.
Kouamé a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbons de bois. Il veut diversifier la marchandise.
Dans les prochaines années, Kouamé voudrait agrandir l’activité et assurer les besoins alimentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Kouamé is a 42 year old man. He is married to a retailer. He has 2 children, both in school. The elder is 7 and the younger 5 years old. Kouamé has worked as a driver/retailer since 2010. He sells sacks of charcoal door to door and is assisted by 1 person. 
Kouamé has requested this first loan with WAGES in order to buy sacks of charcoal. He wants to diversify the merchandise. In the coming years, Kouamé would like to expand the business and take care of the family's food requirements.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: El Buen Pastor Group

texts.es: Marlen tiene 35 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario El Buen Pastor, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, dos de sus hijos trabajan, uno en construcción y la niña en oficios domésticos. Gracias a Dios no tienen problemas de salud pero si problemas económicos ya que a Marlen le gustaría tener una casa de bloque, pintada y bonita porque actualmente su casa es de tabla, también le gustaría tener mayor solvencia económica para ayudarle a sus hijos en sus estudios y ofrecerles un mejor futuro. Marlen desde hace 12 años comenzó trabajando con una pequeña pulpería luego un familiar le ayudo a conseguir un local para que iniciara el negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, actualmente se dedica a esta actividad, ella trabaja en conjunto con una de sus hijas que es la que le ayuda atender el negocio, su horario de atención es de 8:00 am a 6:00 pm. Una de sus ventajas es que tiene muchos clientes, pero en algunas ocasiones el producto se le arruina y pierde la inversión. El préstamo que Marlen solicita lo necesita para la compra de frutas y verduras como ser: sandias, uvas, mangos, bananos, aguacates, melón, chiles, cebolla, tomate, pepinos, repollo, lechugas, entre otros. Con el apoyo de este préstamo Marlen podrá surtir su negocio y seguir teniendo una fuente de ingresos para poder apoyar a sus hijos, este préstamo ha sido de gran utilidad en su familia ya que hizo su casa de tablas, con cimientos de bloques y poco a poco podrá ir terminando su casa de bloque. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y tener su propio local. Marlen tiene 7 años de recibir el apoyo de FAMA mediante los préstamos obtenidos y ha mantenido un  buen comportamiento de pago.
texts.en:
Marlen is 35 years old and a member of 'El Buen Pastor' (The Good Shepherd) solidarity group.  She is the single mother of 4 children.  Two of her children work: one works in the construction industry and her daughter does domestic work.  Thanks to God, they do not have any health problems but they do have financial problems as Marlen would like to have a nice, painted house made from blocks (her house is currently made from planks of wood).  She would also like to have better financial solvency so that she can help her children with their studies and offer them a better future.  Twelve years ago, Marlen started working with a small grocery store.  Then, a family member helped her to acquire premises so that she could start a business selling fruit and vegetables.  She currently works in this business.  She works together with one of her daughters who helps her to serve in the business.  Her opening hours are 8.00am to 6.00pm.  One of her advantages she has is that she has a lot of customers but sometimes her produce spoils and she loses her investment.  

Marlen needs the loan that she is requesting to buy fruit and vegetables such as watermelons, grapes, mangoes, bananas, avocados, melons, chilis, onions, tomatoes, peppers, cabbage, lettuce, etc.  With the support of this loan, Marlen will be able to stock her business and continue having a source of income with which to support her children.  This loan will be really helpful to Marlen's family as she constructed her house from planks of wood, with the foundations made from blocks.  She will be able to gradually finish converting her house to blocks.  Her goals are to expand her business and have her own premises.  Marlen has been receiving loans from FAMA for 7 years and has maintained a good repayment record.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Adakou

texts.fr:
Adakou est une femme âgée de 26 ans. Elle est mariée å un déclarant en douane. Elle a 2 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 7 ans et le dernier a 3 ans.
Adakou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2004. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire tous ses clients.
Adakou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Adakou voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité en ouvrant une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adakou, age 26, is married to a customs officer.  She has two children, ages 7 and 3.  One of her children attends school.

Adakou has been working as a reseller since 2004.  She sells basic food products at the market.  Her customers come from all walks of life.  She buys her goods in Lomé and works alone.  Currently, her major challenge is that she cannot meet all of her customers' demand.

Adakou has requested her first loan from WAGES for the purchase of basic food supplies.  She wants to reinvest in the activity.

In the coming years, she would like to expand her business and open a shop.  She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy basic food products.

loans.name: Tey

texts.en:
Tey, 56, is widowed and resides with her son in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fried bananas for more than 10 years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her son is employed in Korea and earns about USD 34 per day. 

Tey wants to improve her family’s standard of living. With this goal in mind, she would like to run an additional business to generate extra income to support the family. Therefore, Tey is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase farmland for growing agricultural crops. This money will help her acquire the security to start this new business. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for the family.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for growing agricultural crops

loans.name: Ley

texts.en:
Ley, 43, is married and resides with her husband and her parents in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle for more than twenty years, earning approximately USD 6 per day. 

Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 6 per day. In order to improve her husband’s business, Ley is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to purchase construction tools for her husband to use at work. This purchase would give him the ability to bid for bigger construction projects. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools for her husband to use in his work

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a patient and loving mother with one child. Her spouse is a rice grower in the village where they live. To add to her spouse's income, Maribel established a small store selling grocery items. She has been operating it for over five years. Her child is still pursuing her college degree and in need of a daily allowance. 

Maribel was happy that her daily income was used to support the family's needs. She is now asking for a loan to provide additional capital to buy soft drinks, sardines, noodles and soap to sell in her store.

In the future, she would like to keep selling these items to meet all her customers' needs, not only for the affordable prices she offers, but also to be friendly to them.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sardines, noodles and soap to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to by airtime in bulk, cigarettes, sweets and candy to sell.

loans.name: Kelegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KELEGNA est constitué de 4 femmes mariées et 2 veuves ayant en moyenne 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivant  dans des familles nucléaires à MASSABLACOURA  , un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales à travers  ROUTIE, de la  vente de bois de chauffe et de la friperie.
ROUTIE, qui est la seule femme debout sur la photo(les 5 autres étant toutes assises),  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  600 kilos  de maïs. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des paysans producteurs des villages voisins. Elle effectue sa vente à domicile et au marché à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000.FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The Kelenga group consists of four married women and two widows with an average age of 42 and six children. They live in nuclear families in Massablacoura, one of the neighborhoods in the city of Bougouni (the third largest administrative region of Mali).  

To satisfy the needs of their customers, they are on their sixth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organization.  This group of women sells cereal, firewood and used clothing.  

Routie, the only person standing in the photo, sells cereals and plans to use her loan to buy 600 kg of corn.  She sources from farmers in neighboring villages. She resells from home and at the market to a clientele of women and men, for cash and for credit.  

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA, a part of which will be used to help her husband with daily expenses. The other part will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Madjanabou

texts.fr:
Madjanatou est une femme âgé(e) de 32ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur et a 03 enfants dont 01 à l’école. Le premier a 07ans et le dernier a 03ans.
Madjanatou travaille comme revendeuse de sacs de charbons de bois depuis 2008. Elle sert ses clients à la maison et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Elle est aidée par 02 personnes.
Madjanatou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbons de bois.
Dans les prochaines années, Madjanatou voudrait agrandir l’activité en ajoutant la vente de bois de chauffe. Elle veut assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
Madjanatou is a 32-year-old woman. She is married to a driver and has 3 children, one of whom goes to school. The eldest is 7 years old and the youngest 3.

Madjanatou has been working as a charcoal retailer since 2008. She serves her customers from home and gets her supplies in Lomé. She is helped by two people.

Madjanatou has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy bags of charcoal. In the coming years, she would like to expand her business with the addition of firewood sales. She wants to provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
Adjovi est une femme âgé(e) de 34 ans. Elle est mariée à un mécanicien chauffeur et a 03 enfants tous à l’école. Le premier 13ans et le dernier 08 ans.  
Adjovi travaille comme revendeuse de produits de premières nécessités ( riz, huile végétale, tomate en boite, détergents….) à la maison depuis 2007 et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Adjovi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits alimentaires. Elle veut agrandir l’activité, diversifier les marchandises et assurer  les besoins élémentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Adjovi is 34 years old. She is married to a mechanic and has 3 children who all attend school. The eldest child is 13 years old and the youngest is 8.

Adjovi has been working as a retailer of basic supplies (rice, vegetable oil, canned tomatoes, detergents, etc.) since 2007 and gets her supplies in Lomé.

Adjovi has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy food products. She wants to expand her business, diversify her product range and ensure her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr: Madame Akouwa est âgée de 35ans. Elle est veuve et a 04 enfants dont 03 à l’école. Le premier a 14ans et le dernier 01an. Pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, Akouwa vend des ignames et des maïs  à toutes personnes dans une gare routière  de la ville de Lomé. Elle est à son premier crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce montant pour acheter des ignames. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, assurer sa prospérité. Elle veut aussi voire sa famille s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Akouwa is 35 years old. She is widowed and has 4 children, 3 of whom go to school. The eldest is 14 and the youngest 1.

Akouwa sells yams and corn to all sorts of people in a bus terminal in the town of Lomé, so that she is able to meet her children's needs.

This is Akouwa 's first loan from WAGES and she is requesting it so that she can buy some yams. She wishes to reinvest in her business and ensure its prosperity. She would also like to see her family flourish.

loans.use: to buy yams and corn.

loans.name: Bayi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de sacs scolaires et de voyages depuis 2000, madame Bayi est âgée de 57ans. Son conjoint est retraité et elle a 04 enfants. Le premier a 30ans et le dernier 21ans. . Elle est à son troisième crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pout acheter des sacs scolaires et de voyage. Elle veut épargner les profits, assurer sa prospérité et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
57-year-old Bayi has been a retailer of school and travel bags since 2000. Her spouse is retired and she has 4 children. The eldest is 30 years old and the youngest 21.

The is Bayi's 3rd loan from WAGES and she is requesting this loan to buy school and travel bags. She wants to save her profits, ensure her prosperity and meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy school and travel bags.

loans.name: Adjoua

texts.fr:
Adjoua est une femme âgé(e) de 40 ans. Elle est mariée å un  retraité. Elle a 05 enfants, dont 04 à l’école. Le premier a 21 ans et le dernier a 08 ans.  
Adjoua travaille comme revendeuse de chaussures et détergents depuis 2003. Elle vend à la maison à ses clients et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Adjoua a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des chaussures et détergents  Elle veut agrandir  l’activité et diversifier les produits. Elle veut avec les profits aussi assurer les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Adjoua is a 40-year-old woman. She is married to a pensioner. She has 5 children, 4 of whom attend school. The eldest child is 21 years old and the youongest 8.

Adjoua has been selling shoes and detergents since 2003. She sells to her customers at home and gets her supplies in Lomé.

Adjoua has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy shoes and detergents. She wishes to expand her business and diversify her product range. She would also like to use the profits to provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy shoes and detergents.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi est un homme âgé de 44 ans. Il est marié å un/e revendeuse. Il a 04 enfants dont 02 à l’école. Le premier a 20ans et le dernier 11ans.
Kossi travaille comme revendeur de gravier depuis 2000. Il le vend à toutes personnes dans un quartier de la place. Il est à son troisième crédit de WAGES. Cet argent lui servira à acheter du gravier afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients.
Dans les prochaines années, Kossi voudrait épargner les profits, agrandir l’activité et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en: Kossi is a 44 year old man. He is married to a retailer. He has 4 children, 2 of whom are in school. The eldest is 20 and the youngest 11 years old. Kossi has worked as a gravel trader since 2000.  He sells it to all sorts of people in an area of the marketplace. This is his third loan with WAGES. These funds will allow him to purchase gravel in order to better meet his customers' demand. In the coming years, Kossi would like to save his profits, expand the business and ensure the essential needs of his family are met.

loans.use: to purchase gravel.

loans.name: Tédé

texts.fr: Femme de 28ans, Tédé est mariée à un gardien de préfecture et a 03anfants dont 01 à l’école. L’ainé a 07ans et le dernier 02ans.  Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente de céréales et des sacs de charbon de bois à la maison. Elle vend seule et est à son premier crédit de WAGES. Ce montant qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter des marchandises. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, assurer sa prospérité et l’épanouissement de la famille. Elle a démarré son activité en 2006.
texts.en:
A 28 year old woman, Tédé is married to a town hall warden and has 3 children, 1 of whom is at school. The eldest is 7 and the youngest 2 years old. As an income generating activity, she sells cereals and sacks of charcoal from her home. She does this on her own, and this is her first loan with WAGES. The amount she is requesting will allow her to buy stock. 
She wants to reinvest in the business, and to ensure the prosperity and development of the family. She began her business in 2006.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cereals and of charcoal

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina lives at Tallang with her three school age children. Her spouse works as an Overseas Filipino Worker.

Gina buys and sells vegetables. Sometimes, she also plants vegetables such as eggplant and "upo" (bottle gourd) for sale. She has been running this small business for over three years now. She usually earn P3,000 monthly. Apart from her spouse's remittance, she would like to have her own income, so she patiently sells fruits and vegetables.

Now, she would like to increase her earnings. Gina is requesting a loan of P12,000 to buy cabbages, tomatoes, onions, bananas and string beans to sell. In the future, she would like to her business to earn good profits, so she can put up a retail store in front of their house.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, onions, bananas and string beans to sell

loans.name: Armida

texts.en:
Armida is 60 years old. She lives with her husband, daughter-in-law and little grandson. The family is involved in agricultural business. They breed cattle and cultivate land, where they grow potato, beans and wheat.

Armida has applied for this loan to develop cattle breeding. With the requested amount, she will purchase 3 cows. This will allow Armida to earn more income and ensure a brighter future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for 3 cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um is a diligent and humble farmer who has been residing in a peaceful village of Batey district, Kompong Cham province.  She is 46 years old and has seven single children.  Um owns some farmland for her rice farming business, from which she provides enough sustenance for the family.  She works in this business with her spouse and a few children who always help her in their free time.
