Gladys has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming. She says this will boost her farming income and she reiterates she will use the income to improve her family living standards. She is also focusing on expanding her dairy farming as well.

Gladys says the challenges in farming are fluctuations in market prices and animal diseases.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Precilla is from the village of Villaluz. She is forty-nine years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Precilla owns a transportation business providing motorcycle transport to local members of the community. Precilla has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Precilla joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP to maintain the vehicle used in the business.

loans.use: to maintain a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is from the village of Villaluz. She is sixty years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Rosalina operates a motorcycle transportation business. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,300 PHP a month. 

Rosalina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to maintain the vehicle used in her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to maintain the vehicle used in her transportation business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda, forty-four, lives in a rural area of Barangay Cabisera 14-16 province of Isabela. Married to Rodolfo, who works as the driver of a passenger jeep and who maintains their farming business, they are blessed with a happy family life. They hope to provide all six of their children, who range in age from sixteen to one, with quality educations. 

Merlinda is requesting 20,000 PHP a loan for her mini-grocery store to purchase additional supplies of items such as sugar, coffee, milk, detergent and fragrant soap, rice, soft drinks, bottled and canned goods, etc. to satisfy her customers' needs. Her main purpose in seeking to improve the business is to better help her husband sustain the education of their children.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her store.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de 6 femmes mariées, les membres de groupe Danaya vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce, de savons, beurres de karité, d’ignames, gingembre et des gâteaux à base de farine de blé. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégrés  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Yassa (assise à droite sur la photo) est la vendeuse de la farine de blé du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs de farine + 1sac de sucre + 1bidon de 5 litres d’huile et 1 petit carton de bicarbonate. 
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle composée d’enfants et de femmes. 
Madame Yassa compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari dans  certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is composed of six married women living mainly in traditional families and averaging 41 years of age, with four children. They all live in the town of Sikasso (the third administrative Region of Mali) and know each other as relatives and neighbors.

The group members sell soap, shea butter, yams, ginger, and cakes made of wheat flour.
With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their 3rd solidarity loan.
Mrs. Yassa (seated on the right in the photo) is the group member who sells wheat flour. She plans to use her loan to buy two bags of flour, one bag of sugar, one five-liter jug of vegetable oil and one small box of baking soda.

She buys from wholesalers and sells retail, for cash, out of her home or at the market place, to a customer base composed of women and children.
With this loan, Mrs. Yassa plans to achieve an average monthly revenue of 23,000 West African Francs, which will be used to reinvest in the business and help her husband with some family expenses.

loans.use: to buy baking ingredients

loans.name: José Pio

texts.es:
El  señor José tiene 51 años de edad, es soltero. Él se dedica a la agricultura, fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron ese trabajo. Él siempre deja la semilla de la cosecha anterior y lo demás lo compra en una ciudad del oriente del país. 

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de insumos para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Con la inversión podrá trabajar en la tierra, además tendrá programado el consumo para la siguiente época de siembra. Una parte de la cosecha la venderá para mejorar sus ingresos y la otra la guardara para su consumo. José desea sembrar hortalizas como pipían y sandia.
texts.en:
José is 51 years old and single.  He is a farmer; his parents taught him this work.  He always leaves the seeds of the previous harvest, and he buys the rest in a city in the eastern part of the country.

He will use the loan to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.  With this investment he will be able to work the land.  He will also have consumption planned for the next planting season.  He will sell one part of the harvest in order to improve his income.  He will save the other part for his consumption.

José wishes to plant vegetables and fruit like squash and watermelon.

loans.use: to buy supplies to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Badr

texts.en:
Badr is 30 years old, married and has five children who live together in Taiz, Yemen. He has always been characterized by being a person who very much wants to get ahead and this has allowed him to overcome the great diversities life has presented him. 

He has been operating a grocery store for six years. At first, his father provided him with capital and then he went ahead and bought land, opened a gas cylinder store and bought a truck. He’s currently in a store selling all kinds of basic grocery items. 

Aiming at increasing the variety of products he offers his customers, Badr is looking for a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB. This will give him the possibility of buying basic staple items such as soft drinks, sugar, mineral waters and canned food to offer greater variety to his customers. He would like to expand his business and build a house.

In this way, he hopes his business will grow and consolidate within the sector and that his customers will find good service and a wide variety of products in his store. Badr hopes his store will generate higher income so that he can offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items such as soft drinks, sugar, mineral waters and canned food for his business

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is from the village of Villaluz. She is thirty years old. Jennifer is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products to the local community. Jennifer is a loving person and loving mother. 

Jennifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 16,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, spices and breads for her store.

loans.name: Efrelyn

texts.en:
Efrelyn is from the village of Villaluz. She is twenty-nine years old. Efrelyn is married. To make a living, Efrelyn owns and operates a transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport to local members of the community. Efrelyn has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.  

Efrelyn is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle business.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 46 years old and married to Santi, who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children, who are Roshellin – 29 years old and a commerce graduate, and Caren Joy – 20 years old and currently a high school freshman. With a good relationship in the family, Merlita is really inspired in pursuing the business she started because she wants to finance her youngest daughter's college education. They live in the Ilagan municipality. Merlita shared also that the village where they live is a faraway rural place and mountainous.

Merlita wants to request loan assistance for her rice vending business, amounting to PHP 35,000, that will be very helpful to her business. According to her, the loan will be used to purchase sacks of rice and animal feed for her business since they are in demand. The products will be sold at retail prices in order to generate more income for her family and money for school fees for her children. She hopes to upgrade her business through her strong determination, for she believes that with this, she will be able to succeed in all her goals in life.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice and animal feed to resell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 43 years old and has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 4 years. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. Catherine is requesting a loan of Php 20,000 to purchase canned goods, soft drinks, and other basic commodities to sell. Each month, she earns about Php 5,000 doing this type of work. In the future, Catherine hopes that her business will improve to be able to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks and other commodities to sell.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: A very hardworking and loving mother, Jessica is 33 years old and married with four grown up children. She has been engaged in a retail business for four years to have additional income to sustain the needs of her family. For that reason she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy a variety of products such as canned goods, spices and rice for her business. She hopes that someday her business will expand so that she can fill the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, spices and rice for her business.

loans.name: Jose De La Rosa

texts.es: Don José tiene 61 años de edad, es casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales solo uno depende de don José, también tiene 2 nietos a su cargo. El y su familia residen en la comunidad de las cañitas, departamento de Olancho. Don José desde hace mas de 30 años se dedica a la siembra de café, maíz y frijoles, oficio que aprendió de su padre desde que era muy joven, su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 am a 2:00 pm, todos los días va a supervisar la finca de café por si hay alguna plaga. La ventaja que tiene don José es que el cultivo de café le deja buenos ingresos que son con lo que sostiene a su familia. El problema que se le presenta es que no hay entrada para los vehículos ya que el vive en una montaña y se le dificulta trasladar el producto. Don José solicita el préstamo para la compra de abono,  fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra en la temporada de la cosecha de café. Estos préstamos le han ayudado en gran manera ya que compro una maquina para moler café y esto le ha causado mayores beneficios a su familia. Uno de sus sueños es tener mayor producción de café, una casa en mejores condiciones y ver a sus hijos profesionales. Es el segundo ciclo en fama y ha cancelado puntualmente sus cuotas de pago.
texts.en: José is 61 years old. He is married, and his wife dedicates herself to the household tasks. He has 7 children, of whom only one still depends on José. He also has 2 grandchildren in his care. He and his family live in the community of Las Cañitas, in the department of Olancho. For more than 30 years, José has worked growing coffee, corn and beans, a profession he learned from his father when he was very young. His working hours are from 7:00 am to 2:00 pm. Every day he goes to check on the coffee plantings and see if there are any pests. The advantage José enjoys is that coffee growing gives him good income, which is what he uses to support his family. The problem he faces is that there is no access for vehicles, since he lives on a mountain, and it is difficult to transport his products. José is requesting the loan to buy compost and fertilizer and to pay for labor during the coffee harvest season. These loans have helped him greatly, since he bought a machine to grind coffee, and this has brought substantial benefits to his family. His dreams include expanding his coffee production, having his house in better condition, and seeing his children become professionals. It is his second loan cycle with FAMA, and he has made his payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ladis Orlando

texts.es: Orlando tiene 28 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, es casado y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Orlando era empleado de una empresa de café, el sembraba, abonaba y cortaba el café, fue asi como aprendio a cultivar cafe, de su salario empezó a ahorrar y decidió poner su propia finca de café, su suegro le regalo 2 manzanas para que cultivara el café y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien, desde hace 4 años se dedica a la cosecha de café, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 1:00 pm, y cuando es tiempo de la cosecha contrata 10 empleados ya que el trabajo es mayor y la finca necesita de mayor cuidado. La ventaja que tiene es que la cosecha le deja muy buenas  ganancias y  las dificultades que se le presentan a don José es que los vehículos no entran hasta su finca por lo que se le dificulta el traslado del producto. El préstamo que solicita don José lo necesita para mejorar su finca, en la compra de abono y fertilizantes. Uno de sus sueños es tener mayor solvencia económica para mejorar su casa y hacerla mas grande, también poder comprar mas tierras para cultivar mas café y ver graduados a sus hijos. Este es el segundo préstamo que obtiene de FAMA y ha cancelado de forma puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en: Orlando is 28 years old, has two children, and is married. His wife works tending the home. Orlando was an employee of a coffee company. He planted, fertilized, and harvested the coffee beans, and that is how he learned to grow it. He began to save his wages and decided to start his own coffee farm. His father-in-law gave him two plots of land for farming coffee and, thanks to God, it has gone well for him. He has been farming coffee for four years and he works from 6:00 am until 1:00 pm. During harvest he hires 10 employees since it is a big job and the farm needs greater care. The advantage of his job is that it gives him good earnings and the difficult part is that vehicles cannot enter into his land so it is difficult to transport the crops. He will use the loan to improve his farm by buying fertilizers. One of his dreams is to be economically solvent to improve his home and add on to it. He also wants to buy more land to raise more coffee, as well as see his children graduate. This is the second loan he has received from FAMA and he was punctual with the loan payments.

loans.use: buy fertilizers
